Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel Saint-Jacques”
Reviews.Author: Allen P
Reviews.Content: Saint-Jacques is great place to stay. It's centrally located, clean, with helpful and kind staff. Although you're in the heart of Paris, the hotel is a great place to hang out and relax. I've stayed there 3 times, in 3 different rooms and found the rooms to be tastefully decorated. Be sure to enjoy breakfast there...it's always a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: platzyVancouver
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this charming hotel. It was centrally located, (within walking distance of many tourist sites with Metro just a short walk away) . Our "superior double" room was huge by Paris standards and very clean. The bed was very comfortable, the linens were fresh and crisp. The hotel staff was friendly and most accommodating. The only downside was the street noise, that continued into the wee hours of the morning. Not traffic noise, but people walking about and laughing and singing and speaking in loud voices. If I had brought along ear plugs like the other 3 people in our travelling group, I wouldn't have noticed the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it here”
Reviews.Author: Scott C
Reviews.Content: My wife chose this hotel from the pictures on the website and it was exactly what we were looking for. We loved the location close by Maubert Mutualite metro station. The room was quite cosy, but nice, and although we asked for a shower when booking we did not get one - just a bath.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional style with modern fixtures”
Reviews.Author: Jargalant
Reviews.Content: this is a cozy small hotel in a nice part of Paris. Nicely decorated, very clean, quite traditional in a stylish way, romantic bedrooms with very modern bathrooms (the way it should be!) The rooms to the back are quiet. Staff are friendly. The breakfast is expensive at EUR 14 (this is standard for Paris hotels), but one gets a lot for it; contrary to many French hotels, here they serve cheese and ham plus cereals. I'll definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “more than just average - and good location”
Reviews.Author: KBW175
Reviews.Content: If there was a good button I would have chosen that as the Hotel wasnt average but it didnt rate as very good either :) the main reason for that was it was very noisy on the street on the saturday night - this is out of the control of the hotel of course but did make the stay less enjoyable. The hotel is only 5-6 minutes walk to the river and to the Pantheon so great base to explore from. the decor of the room was fine - it had a nice bathroom but wasnt possible to shower as no shower hook (although a shower attachment). breakfast was ok. Staff were helpful and friendly. Nowhere to sit and relax in the hotel after a long day out :(

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Paris, but need more mirrors”
Reviews.Author: SLDXO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Paris for a long weekend. The hotel was clean and charming and the staff extremely friendly. The location is great for getting around, and is pretty close to the St. Michel/Notre Dame stop for the train that comes from CDG airport. The only real detractor is that there is only one mirror--in the bathroom. So, if you are both trying to get ready, it's not ideal. A full length mirror would have also been nice, as would better lighting. But, we could see both Notre Dame and the Pantheon from our room, so I would say booking the best room is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !”
Reviews.Author: TeamScelen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for my 30th. Excellent location, 24 hour reception with very efficient staff. Great rooms. They were happy to accomodate our every need. Checked in early, stored our bag late on check out. Would definatley recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend at Hotel St Jacques”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit small - would have been better if spare single bed (in addition to the double bed) had been removed. Comfortable, clean with nice bathroom. Breakfast buffet comprehensive and tasty. Staff very helpful in suggesting and booking a good restaurant.. Overall contributed to an excellent weekend in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the movie!”
Reviews.Author: Matt Z
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed two nites in this hotel shortly after the New Year. We selected it based on price and being the namesake in Charade. For the price, you cannot beat the location, character, and comfort. The staff spoke English which made things very easy. The details are delightful, antique keys and door locks, cozy room decor, and nice finishes. Pros: Location, style/character, balconies, and staff. Cons: Bathroom (shower smelt musty, toilet would run occasionally, no conditioner provided)

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: C S
Reviews.Content: My teenage son & I spent 2 nights at this hotel during an extended layover in our travels. Having less than 2 days to spend on our first visit to Paris, I picked this hotel for it's centrality to the sites we wanted to be able to walk to. The 1st night we walked to Notre Dame and back. The next day we set out for the Eiffel Tower, crossed over the Seine to the Arc de Triomphe and then down the boulevard & back to our hotel. I hadn't planned on walking that far, but it was very doable. Having the hotel so near the River Seine and all of the popular sites made it a wonderful way to immerse ourselves in the city of Paris! Plus - Very helpful, English-speaking concierge! Minus - Had a hard time finding anything to drink! Bottled water in the room would have been very nice!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, esp if Sorbonne/Collège de France are important to you”
Reviews.Author: DiMe2
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research in preparation for our Paris trip and all roads led, happily, to the Hotel St-Jacques. My optimal features were these: Sorbonne/Collège de France area but not too far up the hill (so within easy walking distance of the two islands); largish rooms (for Europe); reports of comfortable beds (more on this below); nice bathrooms; some charm; a reasonable price; and, yes, no hassles about our having to speak English. This was as one might imagine not an easy search but the St-Jacques fit the bill all around. The beds and pillows are excellent, so much so that we tried to figure out if we could procure something comparable at home. They're on the harder side, which is for us perfect. The bathrooms are lovely and even a bit decadent, with marble and big tubs and bath salts. Plus there is a nice bar in the lobby with quite reasonably priced drinks. Also in the lobby are excellent staff, especially the two women who work the desk. Some of the men, it has to be said, are a bit snide about the English thing (not sure why it divided by gender but it did) but I suppose there's always that.

Reviews.Title: “Post Christmas trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: oliverukrascal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our mothers to Paris as one of their Christmas Gifts. Historically, we have stayed at another hotel in the Latin Quarter during our visits to Paris but decided to try a different venue this time. And we were very glad we did! The hotel is in a great location (Latin Quarter is our favorite area of Paris) and the staff were fantastic. Rooms are very spacious (especially by European/Paris standards), fun balcony and we really liked the crown molding in the room. Great experience and we would glady stay here again! Tres Bien!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: NeilT667
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights in a double room on the top floor of the hotel, the room was street facing but was not at all noisey and the small balcony was a pleasant addition to the room. The staff were very helpful and friendly throughout and the hotel is located close to saint-michel metro which serves several lines so it was easy to travel quickly throughout paris. Room was cleaned to a high standard each day, the bathroom and shower were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Business In Paris”
Reviews.Author: KristinIH
Reviews.Content: I found the attentiveness and service of the staff to be excellent. There were a few walls in the hallways that needed to be repaired - it took away from the aesthetic beauty of the building. But, overall a very nice place in the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, perfect location, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: Sunnyval73
Reviews.Content: I had booked a single room for 4 nights and I was upgraded to a (small) double room, which was awesome. Even though my window was facing the main street the room was quiet and, since the bed was comfortable, I had very good nights of sleep. bathroom and bedroom were cleaned perfectly. I did not have breakfast at the hotel, because for the price offered I found a different cafe each morning where I had marvellous breakfast. I think the location is, however, the best quality of this hotel: near the metro station and also the RER station. Notre Dame district is reachable on foot. I woul without a doubt stay at Saint Jacques hotel again. One last thing to highlight: Ms. Brigitte at the reception desk is highly professional, very kind and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Great location and nice people!”
Reviews.Author: Katiereview
Reviews.Content: I had a really great experience at this hotel! I was traveling with my mom and sister, so we needed a triple room. A lot of hotels in Paris only have single or double rooms, so this fit our need. The room was really cute! It had one double bed and one single bed, a nice tv, a small balcony and a private bathroom. The room was on the smaller side, but cute, clean, and big enough for us! And when you're in Paris you shouldn't be spending much time in your room anyway. The bathroom is tiny, especially the shower, but we didn't mind and I was just happy to have found a hotel with a shower instead of a bathtub. You receive a big old fashioned looking brass key for your room and you turn it in at the front desk each time you leave and pick it up when you return to the hotel. The staff at the front desk were really nice and will speak in French or English to you. The location was perfect! It's a 15 min walk to Notre Dame and there are many restaurants in the area. The hotel has a breakfast each morning, but it's pricey and I would recommend skipping it and just going to one of many nearby cafes for breakfast. Overall I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ah....Saint-Jacques”
Reviews.Author: Weatherhed
Reviews.Content: If you are a young couple or an older couple who needs a "honeymoon" to heat up your relationship all over again, than my wife and I would definitely recommend this hotel in Paris. The hotel is quaint and clean, and everyone is very friendly. Our room was big, and decorated beautifully. Saint-Jacques is centrally located, so we were able to walk to the Latin Quarter, the metro, and many restaurants and bars. We love Paris, but this particular trip was very special because of where we stayed. We will go back to this hotel one day without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week In Paris!”
Reviews.Author: VAJill
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Hotel Saint-Jacques and had a wonderful experience. The location in the Latin Quarter is perfect and the hotel has a charming atmosphere and wonderful staff. The rooms were clean and lovely with modern bathrooms and comfy beds. We loved the breakfast each morning. The location allowed us to walk almost everywhere and the neighborhood has great restaurants. One we really enjoyed was the Petit Prince, just a couple blocks from the hotel. Very special. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris. It is a great place to stay to enjoy this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming old Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: BostonBetty
Reviews.Content: The Hotel St Jacques is housed in an old building. The rooms are typically Parisian-small, but have been carefully decorated; each room has a painted wall mural that sets the color scheme for the room. Beds are comfortable and the bathrooms that we saw were recently renovated. Depending on the room (we saw about 5 of them), bathrooms can be quite small with shower stalls only, but with impeccable design and quality. The windows are double-paned glass, so they are effective at cutting the street traffic noise (we visited in November so it was no problem to have the windows shut). The front desk staff is wonderful - they are friendly and very helpful. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel; instead, we went downhill a block to the square near the metro stop and ate at a cafe there, or went to the adjacent bakery.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: erwinsanta
Reviews.Content: great hotel in a great location, friendly staff. places to shop eat are within a block or two, five minutes walk to Notre Dame , ten minutes to Hotel the Ville.

Reviews.Title: “Two weeks at Hotel Saint - Jacques was wondeful”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaStelz
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris to celebrate our wedding anniversary and Hotel Saint-Jacques was the perfect place to stay. We had a room with a balcony where you could see Notre Dame on your right and the Pantheon on your left. Our room was clean, very pretty, and spacious with a modern bathroom. The staff was wonderful and we had coffee sent up to our room every morning. You can start your day with a full breakfast downstairs if you desire. The location of this hotel is perfect. For the first four days we did not even use the Metro because we could walk to so much. There are wonderful places to eat all around the hotel. If we ever go back to Paris we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Peter F
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three nights at the Hotel St. Jacques. We initially chose the hotel simply because of its location - just around the corner from our friend's apartment; however, we were very glad we chose this hotel. We stayed in a deluxe room. It was roomy enough by Paris standards. Very clean. We really enjoyed staying in an area of Paris that was not overly touristy. Many great restaurants and markets in the neighborhood. Close to everything - Luxembourg Gardens, Isle de France and Notre Dame, the Pantheon and even the street that figures so prominently in the Owen Wilson movie "Midnight in Paris". Lastly, November is a great time to visit Paris - mild temperatures that are great for walking around and less crowded than the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: deeceeHonolulu
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great place to begin your Paris experience. The rooms are individually decorated and very comfortable. The English speaking staff was very helpful and the location is great. The neighborhood is full of restaurants and the main boulevards of St. Germain and St. Michel are only a couple of blocks away. Notre Dame and the Ile St. Louis are also within walking distance. Instead of the hotel breakfast, we had breakfast every morning at a cafe across the street that served coffee and crossants for only 3 euro. The hotel also has excellent free wifi. We first stayed in Room 15 on the 3rd floor which was a little small. Our next stay was in Room 22 which had a balcony and was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: dma71
Reviews.Content: nice hotel, clean, well appointed. courteous and helpful staff. my single room was quite small and on sixth floor, elevator only until the 5th. safe for single woman. bad view but didn't matter as in a great location. near metro station, flea market, bread and cheese shops, saint germain, shops, walking distance from notre dame, rue mouffetard.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer b
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the St Jaques on numerous occassions; with family, friends and most recently with my boyfriend and I simply wouldn't contemplate staying anywhere else. The staff are very polite and friendly and speak excellent English, should you be a little lacking in language skills. The rooms are beautifully furnished, many of them with pleasent views and rarely noisy except in the height of summer. But best of all is the location, literally five minutes from Notre Dame. You won't get a better hotl for the same money anywhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Visit, Still a Charm”
Reviews.Author: kirklandkat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for my third visit over a span of 12 years. We return to Hotel St. Jacques for the location, relative value for Paris hotel rates, and a taste of French charm. The rates are higher than they used to be (even factoring the currency fluctuations). But overall, I still think this is a solid bet for first time visitors and return visits. The bathrooms have been newly updated which is a good improvement. In my experience, the service has been consistently adequate and helpful. About the location: super convenient to Notre Dame, walking distance to many things and the Metro is not far away. We stumbled upon a Saturday morning fresh market a block away that charmed the socks off some of my family who were first time visitors to Paris. A fair selection of cafes nearby as well as a shop for water, etc.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, again”
Reviews.Author: theheadchef
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel a year ago and were over the moon with our room 25, featuring a wraparound balcony and amazing views. This year when we arrived, we were given room 16, one floor down and no balcony. A bit disappointed at first, we quickly adjusted and enjoyed the magnificent murals and elaborate crown molding of the room. Room 16 is just off the elevator and occasionally we would hear a bit of noise in the hallway, but none from any of the other rooms. The street noises are minimal and for me are part of the charm of being in country so far from home. I loved the sounds of unfamiliar voices, sirens and traffic patterns. We slept soundly and comfortably every night. We love the neighborhood, especially the charming restaurants and cafes just a short walk up the hill. We really enjoyed our dinner at The Petit Prince de Paris, also around the corner. This is our favorite little corner of Paris to stay and we can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: DCLawyer20006
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. Rooms were spacious enough for a paris hotel, but far from roomy. Free wi-fi. Rooms were well appointed. Staff was very knowledgeable, English speaking, friendly and helpful. Our room faced Rue Des Ecoles and had a balcony. Despite facing the street it was not noisy. We would stay there again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Am I Staying In The Same Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: SOCIAWG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are staying at the Hotel Saint-Jacques and I am wondering if it is the same hotel that other reviewers have written about. Other reviewers write about warm, helpful staff. The staff that we have dealt with are, at best, cool, seemingly put out when asked for the room key. None of the three different desk clerks has offered any assistance and all seem remote. Have not seen any "friendly" or "helpful" staff. None seems to remember us. So where is Bridget? The hotel is well located in the Latin Quarter and there are many restaurants and stores nearby. The room itself (#2) is clean and a good size for French standards, the bed is comfortable and the bathroom is compact. No shower, just a bath with a hand-held spray and, because there is no shower curtain or enclosure of any typye, if you attempt anything akin to a shower, the floor and walls get very wet. There is no towel hook. With the windows open, the street noice is loud and the only way to sleep is with ear plugs. Also, because #2 has a storage area outside the door, it is very noisy when the cleaning staff starts its routine in the morning. We requested a baloncy room, but were told that the hotel could not guarantee one, so you have to take your chances. We asked again at check-in an where told "no" quite sternly. It does have free wifi and it works well in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: phillygal2
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Paris on 9/26 and took the metro to the Hotel St. Jacques. It was an easy 10 minute walk from the train station. We were greeted warmly by Bridget who informed us our room was ready even though it was only around 11 am. The room had a small balcony overlooking the street with French Doors and a beautiful decor. The room was small but had all we needed. The location is perfect and within walking distance of many great restaurants, Notre Dame, and other local sights. Phillippe helped us tremendously when we could not find our way to the boat rentals and wanted to take a night time cruise on the Seine. He mapped everything out for us and even gave us a coupon for 2 euros off!! I will highly recommend this hotel if you are staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robin B
Reviews.Content: I did quite a search for the best hotel and location and was not disapointed. Our first time in Paris for our 25th Wedding Anniversary and had a wonderful stay. Room was not ready when we arrived but we expected that coming in early in the morning from North America. Left our bags at the hotel and had a coffee at the cafe next door and toured the Panthelon. Room was clean and very comfortable and only real noise on the street was the Friday night when the students let loose. We also slept with the window open every night. Weather was Fantastic for our week stay, record breaking to be exact Brigitte was very helpful. We stayed in room 14.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place-Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: weeshe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located and appointed nicely. They arranged for our shuttle from CDG to their location which was very helpful. I would note to ask for a room that does not look to the street because it was quite noisy. We did not know this as we arrived in late afternoon and people were already leaving to go home. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A total pleasure”
Reviews.Author: sweettoo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Saint-Jacques while visiting Paris. The location is excellent. A 10-15 minute walk to the Seine and Notre Dame, a metro stop just down the hill. The hotel staff were pleasant and professional - always able to assist us. The rooms were more than we expected - larger than we had expected. I stayed on the 6th floor (elevator to the 5th floor and then stairs to the 6th), which overlooked the Rue des Ecoles. Several church spires could be seen from the small walk out balcony. The street was lively late into the evening, but the windows kept most sound out. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was small, but completely renovated, including a shower. The only disappointment for me was that there were no outlets in the bathroom, near the only mirror. Other than that, the room was wonderful. I changed rooms for our last evening and was in room 6 on the 2nd floor (3rd floor for Americans). This room was amazingly beautiful - with a painted ceiling and Belle Epoque styled molding around the room. I would rate this hotel as one of the best I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room and Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: womanatwittsend
Reviews.Content: My good friend and I spent 5 days here to celebrate her 50th birthday. We chose St Jaques based on the TA reviews and were very pleased with our choice. We arrived round 10:30 a.m. and were delighted to find our rooms ready. I was in room 34 and my friend in 28. My room was lovely. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bath was very contemporary with a shower that provided fast hot plentiful water. The thermostat in the room worked well. The rooms use old fashioned (by American standards) skeleton keys. It took a bit to learn how to use them, but we soon got the hang of it. Guests must turn them in when leaving and pick them up when returning. Some may not like this but I found it kind of reassurring. That and I am drawn to things that have both function and beauty. The staff were wonderful! Every one of them. Special thanks to the blonde woman who was so friendly and genuine and provided us with a wealth of information on where to shop based on our tastes and preferences! The downsides of the hotel are as follows. The room is next to the elevator and there was much rumbling and the walls do seem thin as you can hear conversations in the hallway and ajoining rooms quite well. This is the only reason St Jaques did not get 5 stars. Oddly enough despite the noise I slept very well. We were not able to use the outlet in the bath for our curling irons. But I was able to use the outlet by the bed and stretch enough to use it and view the bath mirror "long distance". There limited storage for belongings, however I am not fussy and leaving most things in my suitcase was not a problem for me. As others have mentioned there is a nice market down the street and the Italian restaurant right across the street is indeed wonderful! We liked it so much we ate there 4 times as we knew we'd leave happy! Overall we were very glad we chose St Jaques and if I ever have the opportunity to return to Paris I will be sure to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, clean, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: corjb
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Saint-Jacques. It's a very charming hotel in the Latin District. Many shops, cafes, and other conveniences nearby. Close to the Odeon Metro station. In my room, I slept with the French doors open and the noise was minimal (even though they opened to a street). Would recommend staying here. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Christine A
Reviews.Content: Very good location - able to walk to nearly all the main sites of Paris with easy access to metro if required. Very easy to get to both airports and Versailles from St Michel which is only 5 minutes walk from hotel. Friendly staff without being intrusive. Stayed for 6 nights in superior room - smaller than we expected (a little disappointed), but very clean. Bathrooms modern and clean, although hand held shower could prove a little cool in colder weather! Noisy street, but closing the windows at night lessened the noise considerably. Breakfast ok - cheaper to eat at one of the many cafes close to the hotel. As this is an older hotel ( although refurbished with modern facilities), we did hear noise from the room upstairs. Good hotel in great location, but worth checking others around similar area to compare.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location, just a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: happytogether99
Reviews.Content: As I traveled with my mother who needs a quiet place for a good night sleep, (and myself too) I requested a quiet room upon check-in. The older gentleman quickly responded: "you're at the 6th floor so it's quiet". (I booked a discounted room on the 6th floor which required walking up some stairs- perhaps i was being sensitive but his attitude made me feel like "you're getting a cheap room so what are you asking for?) It turns out the room was facing the big street, and it was okay during the day, but you can hear the traffic at night. As we stayed only two nights I did not spend the time to ask them to change the room, but when I checked out and told the younger man at the front desk, he said there are rooms that are not facing the street and a bit more quiet. So if you need quiet environment for sleeping, be sure to ask them for a room that is not facing the main street. Other than this, the hotel is quite pleasant and breakfast is very nice. I am giving rating 3 because I felt the older gentleman could have been more thoughtful and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: james t
Reviews.Content: They were very friendly and accommodating. They were extremely tolerant of non-French speaking guests. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: looking_blue
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely. Nicely decorated and very clean. The bathroom was pretty small. The shower particularly. But it was manageable. It was too noisy to have the windows open... but the windows cut down the noise so that you hardly noticed it. I didn't like the area the hotel was in as much as I'd expected. While it's convenient to notre dame.. I preferred walking to the 6th quartre. It suited us better as although more expensive food wise it had a much greater selection of cafes, shops etc. The 5th quarter is more grudgy. The 6th is within easy walking distance though. The reception staff were a little abrupt initially but warmed up and were really lovely in the end. All & all... a good experience. Though I would probably try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel, friendly service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: NYMom65
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel in walking distance to Notre Dame and Jardin du Luxembourg. We were a family of 4 with 2 kids (8&10) and we'd definitely stay at the St.Jacques again! ROOMS: Tasteful and romantic. Bathrooms were modern and clean but could use some hooks and shelves. Small compared to American standards but larger than other Paris hotels we've stayed at. Beds were comfortable - no waking up with stiff backs and necks! The doors were heavy and a bit loud and we could hear our neighbors' TV and voices, but earplugs solved that. Good air conditioning. Rooms #18 & 24 had a Queen and Twin, enough for 3 people. SERVICE: Excellent. Helpful and friendly. They arranged tickets for the double decker bus as well as the shuttle bus to the airport. BREAKFAST: Lovely presentation of croissants, pain au chocolat, baguettes, jams, cold cuts, cheese, smoked salmon, cereal and juice in a beautiful room. Very good coffee too (which unfortunately was not the case in most cafes). A bit expensive at EUR13/person but well worth the ambience. LOCATION: We initially thought of staying near the Eiffel Tower, the Champs Elysees or Louvre, but were so glad we picked the Latin Quarter. It is packed with restaurants and cafes. Notre Dame and the Pantheon are a 10-minute walk away. Metro stop was 2 blocks away. RESTAURANTS: The front desk recommended a fantastic place, "Le Petit Prince", around the corner, but be prepared to spend at least 2 hours there. There were only 2 waiters serving a packed crowd. "Brasserie Balzar", a few blocks west was also wonderful. Airy interior with seasoned waiters. Scallops were excellent. There are also tons of moderately priced, ethnically diverse restaurants on the little sidestreets. FOR KIDS: If you ask our kids (8 & 10) what they loved about Paris, they will say the playground at the Jardin du Luxembourg! They absolutely loved the zipline and climbing the Eiffel tower made of rope. There's a section for toddlers and younger kids too. Be warned that some of the contraptions are quite dangerous. We saw several children get thrown off the spinning equipment. The beautiful Jardin is a 15 minute walk from the hotel. The playground is at the south west corner. LAUNDRY: There's a clean coin-laundromat around the corner. Last wash is at 9:30pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mugro
Reviews.Content: We booked this room as a result of reviews on Tripadvisor.com. We found the positive reviews to be accurate and would definitely return to this hotel next time we go to Paris. We booked a triple room, as we were traveling with our six year old son. The room was of good quality and the furnishings and atmosphere were very nice. We did not eat breakfast there, so cannot comment on that. The selling point of this hotel, however, is its location. It is right up the street from a Metro station and there are lots of nice restaurants and cafes in the immediate neighborhood around the hotel. Walking distance to many different sites, including Luxembourg gardens and Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, small and clean”
Reviews.Author: vwhk
Reviews.Content: Paris 5th arrondissement is the original university district and offers a great atmosphere: cultured, playful, central, while more laidback than the neighbouring 6th. Having lived in Paris earlier, this is the primary reason why we selected this hotel. Close to the metro - not the most convenient line in the city; good bus connections, generally overlooked by tourists but much more pleasant than the metro; walking distance to a great many attractions. The staff at Saint-Jacques is friendly while remaining very natural. The place being small, it feels like a family business. We arrived in the morning. All our requests were attended to promptly, with a smile and no fuss. They made us feel at home. The rooms and bathrooms are small but spotlessly clean. Air-con and hot water: consistent with no problem. Noise isolation OK. We would certainly come back and have no hesitation in recommending the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mexicutioner
Reviews.Content: We got the deluxe room and asked for a balcony which we got. The room was nice, spacious and bathroom was the same. Hotel staff was also very nice and helped when we asked questions. Location is great, market 2 blocks away, major metro lines 5- 10 minutes away, Notre Dame and the Seine 5-10 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: snuffie7509
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now. It is in an excellent location- easiest to get to from the RER - airport without walking miles in the métro! The staff is courteous and rooms are confortable. This time though, the lack of shower curtain or glass wall led to water issues in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel - I would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: duclosmi
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the metro and walking distance to Notre Dame and other sights. We stayed in a triple and the room was a nice size compared to other hotels. It was also clean and nicely furnished. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel since it was not included. There are bakeries in the area. If you stay here you have to go to one of the restaurants at the intersection of Rue de l'Ecole Polytechnique and Rue Descartes. Four of them have hired a band together who play in the courtyard and people dance, etc. Wonderful evening.

Reviews.Title: “well located but a little dim”
Reviews.Author: gersfeld
Reviews.Content: In May of this year I stayed at this hotel, at a time when the rates were quite pricey. Although the room was adequate I expected more for the money. The lighting in the room was dim, the furnishings were a bit tattered, and I found the place somewhat depressing, on the whole. Having said that the location is ideal, the staff was adequate, though I didnt avail myself of their services very much. I suppose if the rates are low and you are not looking for luxury the hotel would be satisfactory. Perhaps other rooms are more cheerful but mine was rather dim in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “nice building, - clean - great location but...”
Reviews.Author: billshoreham
Reviews.Content: Nice old building in a great location. Very clean. In terms of services offered poor value for money. Staff Ok but did not excel and on one occasion one was rather rude; a young adult member of our group asked for some afternoon tea in her room and was met with a curt response implying that it was an inconvenient thing to ask for! This may have been a temporary lapse in appropriate customer service by that staff member but it did leave our daughter very upset. She asked me not to pursue this at the time and I told her that I would provide feedback in this way. A shame as this incident spoiled a nice stay and means we will not now return as planned.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverWinelover
Reviews.Content: This as the second time I stayed at this hotel - the first was with my family, this time by myself. The fact that I returned speaks for itself. The hotel itself is really nice - clean rooms, friendly staff. The location cannot be beat - a 5 minute walk from Notre Dame Cathedral, 10 minutes from Rue Mouffetard, 2 minutes from the Pantheon. Plenty of great cafes and restaurants within walking distance. The only drawback to this hotel is the paper-thin walls, may be a problem if you are a light sleeper, but I would still recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: weathjess
Reviews.Content: I have been to Paris several times before, but this was the first to this hotel, and the first to this area. The hotel room was quite big (in Paris standards), we had a very cute little balcony. The only let down for us was the very small bathroom, that had a bath with a hand shower, and I really do prefer a proper shower, particulary as we were there for 4 nights. The staff were pleasant and breakfast was good - although on the dear side. The hotel also gave us a recommendation for a restaurant which was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: judgekw
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a two night stay at the Hotel St. Jacques. This is our third summer to visit Paris and we liked the St. Jacques by far the best in relation to our other hotels. The St. Jacques was in a great location and the gentleman at the front desk, whom I assume is the owner was very helpful, spoke perfect English and was actually nice. This is a bit different than the attitude at our previous hotel. Our room was huge by Paris standards and although it was directly on the street it was very quiet due to double windows. The bathroom actually had double sinks!!! The air conditioning worked great and the shower and hot water were all perfect as well. I was not crazy about the pillow, but that is a very minor issue. The neighborhood around the hotel was charming and you can walk to many sights or hop on the subway. I will most definitely return and have already recommended this hotel to two friends.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: JosieQ11
Reviews.Content: We were three females and felt safe walking around the area. We did arrive to our hotel about 2am one evening and the concierge greeted us outside our hotel when he heard our taxi. Great location within walking distance of underground, several sites within walking distance and great resturants just outside hotel. We stayed in a triple room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Ann35277
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. We liked the location, the room, bath, and people at reception. They helped us with dinner reservations and taxi to Orly airport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for me!!”
Reviews.Author: tgriff99
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at the Hotel St. Jacques in June. I travel alone and this hotel was perfect! The neighborhood in the Latin Quarter was safe and vibrant. Alive with people and many restaurants with outdoor cafe's. I used public transportation to do my sightseeing and this hotel was close to the train and buses which was great. The room was bigger than I expected (listening to everyone who says that european hotel rooms are small) and the staff was wonderful. I did not have the breakfast that was available at the hotel but I spoke to other guests that said they enjoyed it. I would defintely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a charming zone of paris! we loved it”
Reviews.Author: belfagor50
Reviews.Content: nice room with balcon on blvd st germaine! courtesy from the staff! everything ok

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Formans
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our 3 night stay at this hotel. From the moment we walked in the door, the front desk team took care of everything for us! We had one room on the first floor and one room on the fourth floor. We were concerned about the noise from the street but we never heard anything during the night! This hotel has a perfect location and is only a 10 minute walk to many of the major attractions. In addition, the metro stop and the bus stop are less than one block away from the hotel. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but it smelled tremendous and other guests told us the breakfast was wonderful! Thanks for the outstanding hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: slibee
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel from May 11 to May 18, 2011. The room was petite and nicely decorated. The location of the hotel was convenient. The best Nutella and banana crepe wagon we found on our trip was around the corner (thickest spread of Nutella) from the hotel. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning and it was very nice. The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. The bathroom became waterworld when we showered. The tub had a hand held shower head and no curtain. We tried to be green and save our towels for the next day, but we couldn't figure out how to shower without flooding the floor. We had very comfortable stay and were very happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location & top quality”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigirl58
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights. Fabulous small, Parisian hotel and excellent staff who spoke English or French to suit. Rooms beautifully decorated. Beds very comfortable. Location is perfect. You can't go wrong here! And the staff make sure you are looked after. 50 metres to metro and on the Roland Garros line. 50 m to little market held most days, and excellent shops/cafes/bistros/restuarants nearby. Hard to beat. Small boutiques are much better than big chain hotels, and this hotel is brilliant in every respect. Book early. I noted many walk in tourists being turned away as the Hotel was full. No hesitation recommending Hotel St Jacques and its team.

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect Paris”
Reviews.Author: aballoubonnema
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saint Jacques was a great hotel for our Paris trip. Out of all my trips to Paris, this hotel was by far the best value I've seen. The hotel staff was very kind and eager to help. Even the cleaning staff was super nice and friendly. We stayed on the sixth floor: what a fantastic view of the city. The only complaint I have is how thin the walls were. You could literally hear the people in the next room breathe/cough/sneez. Other than that... the hotel is fantastic. I highly recommend this establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Charming accommodations, helpful and efficient staff, a thoroughly delightful stay.”
Reviews.Author: NCP2011
Reviews.Content: A quiet retreat, elegantly appointed and beautifully maintained. Convenient to Pantheon, Notre Dame, St. Chapelle, and the Louvre. One block from bus stop for easy access to Eiffel Tower/Orsay area, and a 5-minute walk to Metro station. Lively street market adjacent to Metro Tues., Thurs., and Sat. Good neighborhood boulangerie, restaurants, and ATM access. I would gladly return for an extended stay and would recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice!”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaBFH
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here! The location was great - an easy walk to the metro and tourist attractions without being right in the middle of the craziness. We actually walked to most of Paris from the hotel! The room was sparkling clean, everything was comfortable, and the staff was very friendly. The room was cute (one thing I loved about the hotel is that it really felt like we were in Paris, and not like a typical chain hotel!). We had a little bit of street noise at night when we left the door to the balcony open, but the door itself was soundproof. The balcony was a great addition - we loved sitting out there in the mornings and evenings! We never had the hotel breakfast, but there was a little bakery up the street that we went to almost every morning. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for city trip”
Reviews.Author: CatmaNL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very charming and at a great location. It's difficult to add something to the positive comments of the other reviews as there is nothing to complain about. Room, service, check-in and breakfast were perfect. We were also very happy with the Velib-station (cheap rental bikes) next to the hotel: this is a great way to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: n2011
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room with a great view and a wonderful Parisian feeling to the decor. The hotel's neighborhood was full of great place to sit, people watch and enjoy a glass of wine or a meal. The hotel staff was helpful and provided helpful information when requested.We would absolutely stay at the Hotel St Jacques again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel near the Sorbonne and Panthenon. 10 minute walk to the river and Notre Dame. Hotel is small but perfectly formed. We arrived about 11am but were welcomed and checked in imediately. We paid extra for a superior double which was on the 4th floor. The room was really big for Paris standards. Lovely clean bathroom. 2 double french windows with a small balcony onto the street. Room was very clean and had adequate storage. Bed was really comfy with crisp clean sheets. Only negative would be that some of the furniure was looking a bit tired. Dont bother with breakfast. Its 13euros. For 6.50 you can get a great breakfast next door. Hotel has a luggage room too so if you want to leave your bags on the last day its handy. Best thing about the hotel is its location. There are loads of bars, restaurants and sights nearby

Reviews.Title: “Lovely (albeit pricey) Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AnonymousUS
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. It was beautiful, clean, and well-situated. I felt like I was staying in an 18th century manor-house. However, the hotel is quite expensive (but so are most Parisian hotels.) Also, (and this isn't the hotel's fault), you could hear revelers far in to the night and morning. If you need complete silence, this hotel might not be for you. Still, if I am ever lucky enough to return to Paris, I plan to stay at this hotel again. I had a wonderful experience overall. :)

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: albeeee
Reviews.Content: We did some checking and chose Hotel St Jacques based on research, yes location is a winner, we had a larger room on the top floor Rm 25, but in all honesty, we were somewhat underwhelmed. Street traffic was really loud- drunken students and mopeds each night, as was the lack of insulation between rooms, we could hear a mother and son fighting at 3AM, word for word. Breakfast prices should be cut by 50% to be fair based on quality. Overall, all 2 star rated hotels in this area seemed the same, good but not great as described. Bottom line- how comfortable were the beds and how well did you sleep should be the one desired result - 6.0 out of 10.0

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and wonderfully traditional Paris hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PJLindy
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris many times and this hotel is superior to the others we’ve stayed in. It is within easy walking distance from many “required” sites, and the opportunities for new adventures (i.e., new favorites) is endless. There is a Metro stop a block away. The hotel was very clean and quiet. Although the elevator didn’t work for a few hours, it really was no problem. One suggestion: the in-house breakfast is a bit pricy, but there are great places nearby to get croissants and other fresh food and coffee (Try the Vos Instants Gourmands on Rue Des Carmes, just a block away). I am looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Paris charm in a great location”
Reviews.Author: So_much_to_see084
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a charming find, well-located within the Latin Quarter and within walking distance of some of the key things we hoped to see on our first visit to Paris -- Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Seine and some of its magnificent bridges, Ile St. Louis. Our room was quite pleasant, windows overlooking a lively street that quietened nicely. Nearby, a market and a number of cafes. A breakfast offered by the hotel was more than adequate to get us going for the day. We'd happily return here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous gem, Terrific location, Charming”
Reviews.Author: sftravelstheworld
Reviews.Content: We LOVED our stay at this charming boutique hotel. The rooms were very clean and beautifully decorated. The front desk staff was helpful and so nice. But the best part is LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. A block from the Metro and the BEST outdoor marketplace! A great place to stay for our first tirp to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great price...helped make our stay in Paris wonderful”
Reviews.Author: trips1546
Reviews.Content: Clean, well decorated, decent size, helpful staff, excellent location. We arrived at the hotel early in the morning from London and knew we could not check in until later that afternoon, but wanted to drop our bags off. The hotel has a locked luggage room that we were able to leave our stuff in for the day. It was great to drop it off and not worry about it while we started exploring the city. Our room was one of their least expensive in the hotel and on the top floor. I thought the room was nicely put together including wall paintings and the furniture. The room was a decent size, especially by European standards. While our room would seem tiny to anyone from the US who stays at our typical chain hotels, Europe doesn't operate that way. To get a room as big as you would find in the States, you need to go 4 or 5 star. So if that is what you are looking for and can afford, then I wouldn't recommend this. However, if you understand that European hotel rooms are much smaller, then you will be pleased with the Saint Jacques. Our room also had a lovely balcony looking over the street. Had no problem with noise from the street or from other rooms. Is the type of hotel where you leave your key at the front desk when you leave, which I really like because its one less thing to carry and worry about. The bathroom was large, a tiny shower with wonderful water pressure...better than mine at home. The room and bathroom were clean when we arrived and maid service each day to replace towels and make up the bed and empty trash cans. Just what we needed. They don't vacuum evert day if that's something that you care about. A very tiny tv, with mostly french speaking channels except for BBC news. But who cares....you are in Paris...you shouldnt be watching tv. The front lobby of the hotel is small, but beautifully decorated. The front desk staff, especially the female receptionist were great. All bi-lingual and helpful. Gave two great dinner recommendations and answered any and all questions we had about our trip. They also provide a laptop to be used in the lobby which was so helpful as neither of us had brought a computer! Never had any meals at the hotel, always ate out so can't comment on this aspect. The location was ideal. A 5 minute walk to the subway and 10 minutes to Notre Dame and 20 to the Lourve. Safe street, never felt unsafe walking back to the hotel at night. Overall, a great hotel for the price. Im a bit spoiled by nice hotels in both Europe and the US, but I was on a budget for this trip and the Saint Jacques provided me with a good price and everything I could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Travelbound44
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in the hotel. We have written favorable reviews in the past and will gladly do it again. Helpful staff, very clean. Good size room for Paris. Metro and bus very close as well as major sights, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BPisReady
Reviews.Content: This is a good choice for a moderately priced hotel in Paris - it's in the Latin Quarter and close to many restaurants, cafes, shops, grocery stores, etc. There's even a hardware store and laundromat within a few blocks if needed; a 5 minute walk to the Metro. This hotel is very clean and modern; I've stayed there twice and had a good experience both times. The rooms are somewhat small (unless you pay for the larger rooms) which is typical but have sufficient room; the free wireless internet works well. Rooms on the back side of the hotel are very quiet; all of the staff speak English.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Holiday Trip”
Reviews.Author: getupdosomething
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel St Jacques and was very pleased with our stay. The room was the double deluxe room and was more spacious than we expected. As others state the elevator was quite small, but we made due with one person going up at a time with luggage and using the stairs to the fourth floor when needed--everyone needs to use the stairs more frequently anyways. The staff was always pleasant and most spoke English which was very nice even though we should have brushed up more on our French--we were in France afterall! We chose not to eat the breakfast a the hotel becasue other less expensive options are available at the street vendors. One treat we should have taken more advantage of was the very reasonably priced drinks at the small hotel bar. Also the free wi0fi was a cost saver! The staff also recommended some great eats! Convenient to the Metro and other quaint streets in the latin quarter! Would definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: KenLynne_10
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a surprise birthday present from our children. Having stayed in several three star hotels on previous business trips to Paris we were very pleasantly surprised by our experience at the St. Jacques. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating, the bed was very comfortable and the room spotlessly clean. The hotel is located close to the Notre Dame area and its varied restaurants. "Getting there" from the airport was easy (on the RER to St.Michel/Notre Dame - 5 minutes walk to the hotel). We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “A great Parisian Hotel with an A+ Staff”
Reviews.Author: arewethereyet3
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hotel St Jacques in late August and I have to say it was a wonderful stay. This is a little gem of a boutique Hotel in a perfect location. Two blocks from La Sorbonne in the Latin Quarter which is packed with Bistros and cafes .An easy 10 minute walk to Notre Dame,& Ile De La Cite and 5 minutes to the Jardin du Luxembourg, The entire staff went out of their way to ensure our family had a great time.No matter what we needed Brigitte, Joe and everyone on staff were there to make us happy. Very helpful with tips on how to get around Paris. The Breakfast was sensational. Not cheap but quite a bounty of wonderful foods when compared to lesser quantity breakfast at nearby establishments. We had a lovely room that was ample for 2 adults and a young teen. The bathroom was new with marble everywhere nice bath products and an incredible waterfall shower. I have told friends about our great experience at the Hotel St Jacques and would return for the amazing hospitality anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, charming staff.”
Reviews.Author: dizzyj66
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a triple room, and found it charming, with modern bathroom and very comfortable beds. Decoration throughout the hotel was excellent, and the staff really helpful. The location was very convenient, with a very pleasant 10 -15 minute walk to Note Dame. I would have absolutely no qualms recommending this great hotel to anyone, already have! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “So Shabby Chic, so French”
Reviews.Author: estatictravellers
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel. It was just want I wanted in Paris. This hotel is extremely comfortable and cozy. The rooms are very French, with lovely details. It is an old hotel so it is not perfect, the floor boards creak, but the ambience is warm and welcoming. The only thing I must mention is that there is no small fridge in the rooms which would be a great addition. The bathrooms are fully renovated with good amenities and great hot showers. The breakfast is adequate, not hot although you can pay extra for eggs and bacon, in a lovely breakfast room in the basement. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect, a 10 minute walk and you are in the madness of the Latin Quarter at night, Bvd St Germain, Notre Dame, it is all there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable Paris 3 Star Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CAROLINEDUNORD
Reviews.Content: Nice 3 Star hotel with clean and comfortable rooms. Very helpful staff but location is a bit away from tourist areas. I was disappointed in eating options in the area, but it is very convenient for a rail trip to CDG.

Reviews.Title: “a latin quarter classic”
Reviews.Author: josgon
Reviews.Content: A charming, old-style hotel in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Well maintained, with friendly service and an unbeatable location.

Reviews.Title: “great locatio but very noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: AnnOH29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. We could explore most of Paris on foot. For this reason alone it was well staying here. However it was very noisy at night and the sound of passing traffic and late night revellers kept us awake into the early hours. My advice would be to bring ear plugs.!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rummii
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I very much enjoyed our stay at this beautiful hotel. The location was great, situated in St Germain, a beautiful quiet part of Paris, but still very central. The only thing I would point out is that, though the nearest Metro (Maubert Mutualite) is a two minute walk away from the hotel, only one line stops there. However, more serviced stations are 5/10minute walks in different directions, so it is always very easy to get back. Our room was slightly smaller than expected, but having requested both a non smoking and balcony room we were delighted that we were given both (as they had warned us that they cannot promise to meet all requests). The decor is just as you see on the website; clean and romantic, and we even had the room with the picture of the lady reading ;) ! The bathroom was considerably smaller than I had expected but I have to say it was actually perfect! The suite seemed new and very clean (again we were lucky and had a tub with shower head), and we loved the solid metal shower and sink fixtures, whose weight indicated their quality. And the water was lovely and hot! The staff were polite and very helpful when we asked for their help. The only oddity was that you cannot iron clothes at the hotel (they suggested we use a local laundrette for next day service!). All in all, I would very much recommend this hotel, and wish we had been able to stay there for more than just one night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sessional
Reviews.Content: We were very comfortable booking this hotel after reading the reviews and the hotel did not disappoint. From checking in, to departure, we felt welcome and all the staff were very accomodating. You were left with the feeling that nothing was too much trouble. The location itself was all that we could have hoped for - 10 minutes stroll to Notre Dame with many good restaurants in the area. Breakfast in the hotel was in our opinion better value than the nearby cafes/restaurants. Our room was tastefully decorated and the feeling was that it was cosy rather than small. Spotlessly clean - the only suggestion we would make would be to introduce coffee making facilities in the room. It would not cost the hotel a fortune and I am sure would be appreciated by all the guests. Certainly one of, if not the best small hotel I have stayed in and I have travelled extensively. The whole ambience of the hotel left us relaxed and able to enjoy the sights of Paris so much more. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to even the most discerning traveller. If we return to Paris, this hotel will be top of the booking list. Congratulations to the management and staff - good service and value for money are rare commodities these days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: s_deamer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Saint Jacques is a very nice hotel in a terrific location within easy walking distance of the Pantheon, Notre Dame, Latin Quarter etc. Staff very pleasant & helpful, lovely room with great view. Should I return to Paris I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “No respect for their customers.”
Reviews.Author: groj
Reviews.Content: Arter having read about the hotel here om tripadvisor, And heard recommendations from feiends, I really lokkes forward to spend 3 nights vere. We booked early, 2 months ahead to be sure to get a nice room, And we paid for a superior room. We had to pay when booking the room. after the experience with the staff at St Jaques I Will certainly never do that again. When arriving Friday afternoon they gold us they had changed pur room to a room at the ground floor. This room in itself is a Nice room. The problem is that the windows Are facing directly lut to the Busy rue des ecoles. So if you open the curtains to Get some light into the room, everyone passivt can look straight into your room. And what is Even worse, you can't open the windows to Get some "fresh" air. We came into the room in the afternoon after sightseeing, And it was hot as a oven. The receptionist had to open the windows with a spesial key. We Asked to love to aborter room, And finally after tak days we have got aborter room. A snakk room up at 6 floor, the cheapest room in the hotel! I claimed some compensation, for the room with no Windows to open And for moving to a cheaper room, but the receptionist just says that it was our own choice to move from the superior room ! (at the ground floor), to the tiny one in 6th floor. Sorry, but when i pay 130 euro a night for a hotel room, I want to be able to look out of the windows without being stared at by people passing by..... Thank you, hotel St jaques for almost ruining our stay in Paris! I would have moved to another hotel if I hadn't been stupid enough to prepay when booking.....

Reviews.Title: “why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: theheadchef
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris half a dozen times over the years, staying at various one and two star hotels, the Hotel St. Jacques was a revelation. Location was perfect, close enough to walk to Notre Dame in 10 minutes and two minutes to the metro, yet on a quiet street out of the mad hustle and bustle of the latin quarter. Our room was a superior double on the fifth floor with a wrap-around balcony and gorgeous views! We loved coming back each evening after a long day of walking, to sip a glass of wine and gaze out at the city from our window (we brought our own cork screw!). Looking in one direction is Notre Dame and then gaze in the opposite direction to see the Parthenon. Very cute cafes and restaurants located up the hill on the street behind the hotel. We had our breakfast at a cafe on rue des Ecoles every morning for about half the price of the hotel's 12 euros breakfast. The room was small, but it served us perfectly. The bathroom had a shower and I admit the only missing element for me was a bathtub. The bed was very comfortable. We heard some street noise at night, but nothing excessive and it added to the charm of being in a foreign country, hearing tables being dragged out to the sidewalks in the mornings at the outdoor cafes. The staff was friendly, but low key and helpful when asked. We could not have been happier with our stay and already dreaming of our return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: tf68
Reviews.Content: The hotel, is cute. quite old you can tell there was never a lift there when it was built, and the life kinda reaked me out so we took the stairs most of the time (which made alot of nosie) but the rooms were lovely, very clean i mean honestly who goes to paris to stay in a hotel room, it was big enough and the sleep quality was good enough for an adventure filled holiday. i would like to make a piont of not bothering to include breakfast if you like hot food (such as bacon n eggs) they can cook it for you but their buffet is a cold continental, each to their own, but we ate at other places most times. the staff at the front desk were cool and friendly, and the keys for the room are massive and old style, so they will hold onto the keys for you every time you go out of the hotel, which i was really pleased about, wasn't really up for carrying that key around and you know you wont lost the room key that way. Right across the road was a resturant called La Petite Perigourdine 39 rue des Ecoles and we ate their every night the food was amazing i would go back to paris just to eat there!! the service was great too, so if you stay in this hotel i recommend this resturant, or if you stay in a hotel around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to transport, bistros and significant tourist sites.”
Reviews.Author: scheza
Reviews.Content: Day staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was everything we needed especially as it included cereal but it did cost 12 euros each. We booked a larger double room but just as well there was an additional single bed because otherwise there wasn't enough room for two suitcases. The bathroom was tiny but modern and everything in the hotel was very clean. The ambience of the Hotel St.Jacques meets all the expectations of the advertised photos. We had a very late flight out of Paris but were able to leave our luggage in the luggage room and were also able to use bathroom facilities and the lounge area. I loved staying here and especially loved this area of Paris. Lots of students and places to eat, close proximity to buses as well as the Metro and close to Notre Dame and the Museum of Medieval History ( used to be called The Cluny) - don't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: bref711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absoultely loved this hotel. The location is great!!! From our room #8, you had a small balcony with a table and chairs (which the second floor is the only one that offers this). You look down one side and have views of the Pantheon and down the other you have views of Notre Dame. The decore was charming. The one compliant that we had was that you could clearly hear the other rooms around you. We would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: houndcrazy
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel St Jacques, everything was as it seemed on the website, it was a comfortable, inviting, homey place that is located in the wonderful Latin Quarter. We loved that we were so close to everything, we even walked back from the Louvre one evening, finding great cafes along the way. I would highly recommend this hotel for your Parisian stay...it was well situated and the cost was very affordable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Audrey Hepburn charm, location and friendly efficiency”
Reviews.Author: Timandsally
Reviews.Content: This the second time we've stayed in this charming hotel (the location for the Audrey Hepburn / Cary Grant movie 'Charade') and as before we had a very good experience. The belle epoque features are lovely and the location is perfect. The rooms seemed to have been updated since our last visit 2 years ago and now boast flat screen TVs and for those that can't do without, there's also free WiFi throughout the hotel. Brigitte on the front desk is an absolute gem and on the day we checked out dealt coolly and efficiently with booking taxis for 2 slightly fraught couples (including us) when none were available, checking in new arrivals and assisting another guest to print his emails. The other staff are also very friendly and delivering room service breakfast to our 5th floor room wasn' t any difficulty. We will definitely be back when we next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay in quaint hotel located in a nice pocket of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ppowers12
Reviews.Content: *near a train line (maubett/mobilite) *Bridgett - the lady who runs the place is very kind and efficient *The rooms are clean. And the bathroom is updated. *free internet -- huzzah *decently priced

Reviews.Title: “Charminig, well located hotel at a reasonabe price”
Reviews.Author: antoninus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a beautiful neighborhood on the left bank (Latin Quarter, 5th arrondisement). It is close to many wonderful sights and areas including The Pantheon, Luxembourg Gardens and the charming Mouffetard district with its diverse restaurant scene and food markets.. We were there for 7 nights and never had a problem; the staff was friendly and spoke excellent English. The only drawback was the small size of the room for 7 nights (small bathroom as well). But the facilities were first class with air conditioning and water pressure excellent and the room had charm including a mural on the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for Single Traveler”
Reviews.Author: jkotler
Reviews.Content: I am always leery of hotel claims when traveling alone, as they rarely post pictures of their single rooms and they are often kind of yuk. NOT SO the Saint Jacques! LOVELY room! Incredibly excellent service--especially from the gifted Brigitte and the wonderful night guy who brought us coffee at 6 am the day of our departure. I would SO stay here again--and am planning to.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, quaint hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: 255XB
Reviews.Content: I took my fiance to Paris in May this year for a last surprise trip before we get married in Thailand next year. We arrived in Paris via the Eurostar and found it very easy to navigate our way to our hotel on the Paris Metro system. On arrival we were met by very polite staff who spoke English even though I did try to speak with them in what little French I know. The room was lovely with a view out onto the charming street below. We stayed in a Superior Double room. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of room for a short 3 night stop. The bathroom was a little small, but for the centre of Paris you get what you pay for and for what we paid it was a very good room. It is well within walking distance of Notre Dame, and the Louvre and we even walked along the Seine to the Eiffel Tower one afternoon. We were lucky and had very good weather whilst we were there. All in all I would say it was a lovely hotel and well priced for the centre of Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: StainesWideyed
Reviews.Content: The hotel, made famous by Cary Grant and Audrey Hepburn in Charade is pleasant, clean and well located in the Latin quarter of Paris. There is plenty of atmosphere in the Latin quarter but it did become noisy until late into the night on the Friday we were there. The location of the Latin quarter and Paris' compactness means that all areas of the city are easily reached from there. Our room as small, being a 6th floor garret room but was comfortable and other rooms on lower floors were a good size. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is the place I'd visit again”
Reviews.Author: Fromacastle
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful location, calm and professional staff, romantic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel avec charme”
Reviews.Author: tripyBUD
Reviews.Content: We have spent 6 nights at this hotel in a small room at the 6th floor. The room had balcony looking to the Sacre Coeur and Notre Dame. The elevator took us to the 5th floor and a narrow spiral staircase to the 6th. This is not recommended for old people but is very charmy for youngs. The hotel including the room is very clean, towels were changed daily. AC in the room. The breakfast it is a little bit expensive (12.5Euro), but it is worth it. Contains salmon, cheese, fruit, cereales, yoghurt, confiture, butter, orange juice, croissant. The breakfast room is intimate, the lady who serves the breakfast is very friendly. Location of the hotel is perfect, close to the metro station (Moubert Mutualité), a lot of restaurants and bistros nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It's the perfect place to stay in the Latin Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: Franc0phile65
Reviews.Content: Service is friendly and efficient. We have stayed in several different rooms at the hotel. All were well decorated, some with murals of old Paris scenes, and had bright modern bath/shower rooms. Breakfast is optional, with a supplement, so if you prefer you can go out to one of the many local cafes. We like those in the Place Maubert where we can drink our coffee while watching people shop at the open-air market (Thursdays and Saturdays). It's a short walk to the Jardin du Luxembourg, a longer walk to the Jardin des Plantes, a Metro ride to other attractions. This may not be the cheapest Paris hotel, but it is my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful first experience in Paris.. the location is just perfect”
Reviews.Author: firsttimeinpariskate
Reviews.Content: It was a short walk from the Luxembourg station to the hotel, (all though the St.Michel station is closer), and as soon as I walked into the lobby, I knew I would be happy there. Everything about the place was so quintessential 19th century Paris. The lobby is so clean and elegant, the soft paintings on the walls were romantic, and the winding staircase was a big part of the charm of the hotel. The room was very small by American standards, but the full size bed made up for the small quarters. The walls were a bit thin and I could hear the next door neighbor blowdrying in the morning, but other than that, it seemed everyone was cooperating to stay quiet in the rooms. Also, my room (34) was facing another window, away from the main street, so it was very quiet with lots of sunlight. I simply loved the bathroom. Tiny, but so immaculately clean and with all new appliances. The shower had amazing water pressure. Also, the sheets and towels always smelled so fresh! The service was just the way I like it; not over-the-top friendly, but very professional and always helpful and to the point for any questions I had. I would go back there in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, comfortable, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: agabu
Reviews.Content: In the very center of Paris, but quietly located. Excellent access to metro, and walking distance to the most important tourist attractions. A lot of cafes and restaurants around, small groceries as well. We had the room on the top floor, with (very small) balcony - excellent view, spacious enough - especially if you compare it to other hotels in Paris. Rooms on lower floors are probably bigger. A/C quiet and effective. Spotless clean, towels changed daily. We didn't use their breakfast - we found a very nice cafe nearby. If back in Paris - will go there definitely once again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for an elegant short stay in Paris right near Notre Dame and the Louvre”
Reviews.Author: Pigmango
Reviews.Content: Hotel St Jacques is a small, charming, friendly boutique hotel. Apart from the small lobby, there is a tiny lounge/bar where you can read magazines and sip absinthe and also a nice breakfast room. The rooms are smallish but spotless and lovely, with elegant furnishings and windows and balconies. We were on the second floor, and from our balcony we could see the Pantheon in one direction and the top of Notre Dame in the other. The lift is very old and cute, and the spiral staircase is beautiful. We could walk to Notre Dame (5 mins) and the Louvre (20 mins). The metro is really close for the short trip to the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. The Pantheon is at the end of the street - one minute away - where Marie Curie, Victor Hugo, Rousseau and others and are in the crypt. There is also a very nice food market on some days at the bottom of the street towards the Seine. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Wi-fi is free and fast. Breakfast was good. Our bathroom was clean and a reasonable size, with hair dryer and toiletries. The street has a few good, very casual bars. The Uni is close by so there are lots of earnest students filling the bars. The concierge directed us to two very good close restaurants. Go out the front door, turn left, then turn left again and walk up the side of the hotel towards the Pantheon. Cross the street at the first intersection and go down the side street beside the bar. Halfway down are the two restaurants, on either side of the street. The service and food at the one on the right is best - we went in at 7pm and got the only unreserved table. By 8pm it was full of Parisians. Beautiful meal - moderately priced but worth it. The restaurant opposite has good food too, but the service is not as good. We have stayed in lots of hotels in different cities, with very varied rates, and we'd class the Hotel St Jacques as small, medium cost with great service. This is not a hotel for people who only like 5 star. But if you are flexible in your expectations, you will be very happy. For example, we stayed in the Ritz Carlton Singapore on our way home which was extremely luxurious, but we loved the genuine Parisian feel of the Hotel St Jacques. We thought that it was great value, in a perfect location, and we will happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Week At The St. Jacques...C'est Bon!”
Reviews.Author: Italy4
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading all the helpful reviews on Trip Advisor. We booked a room about 6 months in advance mentioning that we would be celebrating our 40th anniversary and requested room #6 but unfortunately it was not available when we arrived. We were given room #16 which worked out just fine for us. It met all our criteria for a perfect stay...clean, quiet, and comfortable. The location was convenient to the Metro. There is an excellent boulangerie a block away to the west that had great espresso and served breakfast, lunch and dinner at reasonable prices. A block away to the east was a handy pharmacy. There are several restaurants in the area to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable good quality hotel in a wonderful location with free high speed Wi-Fi”
Reviews.Author: renatasydney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Latin Quater, walking distance: 2 minutes to Pantheon, next to Sorbonne, 15 min to Notre Dame de Paris, 25-30 mins to Louvre. Metro is about 5 minutes away. There're many restaurants and cafes in the area, and Boulevard St Michel and St Germain are right there with many nice shops. The hotel is very nice, staff helpful. Breakfast is 12.50 euros which is not cheap and consists of pastries, bread, cheese, some parma ham and salami, smoked salmon, jam, honey, tea and coffee, freshly squeezed juice and if you want some eggs it is extra (eg hard boiled egg 4 euros). The room 29 we stayed in is on 6 floor (lift goes to level 5 and then you walk two flights of stairs - 10 steps?) which is fine if you are healthy and don't have heavy suitcases to carry.
