It's small, but clean and the bed is comfortable, although small. The bathroom is tiny, but shower is of a good size. The street is very busy but it's not noisy in the room. It doesn't have a kettle and they are not happy to provide you with plates and cups if you want to eat food you bought. There's no mini-fridge and they don't provide an iron and ironing board. Having said all that, if you're happy to eat out or use plastic plates and cups and go to laudromate to iron your clothes this place is perfect base in Paris. I would definitely recommend it to anyone and will stay there again if I'm lucky to go to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: McCansethetraveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Jacques is a lovely little hotel with a charming interior, well appointed rooms and a friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay and were happy to find that they had been "promoted" to 3 star status -- we couldn't imagine that such a fine hotel was listed as only 2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: AgingSlowly
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay in early June was very comfortable and happy. Superior double room was of a reasonable size with a good sized bathroom. The painting on the ceiling and wall gave it great character. Windows onto the street gave it a pleasant outlook withour too much noise. Staff were all helpful and obliging with more than enough English to get things straight, Pleasant little bar for that aperitif or cleansing ale. Small jerky lift gave some concern initially but then added to the character. Great location with a stroll to the river, Notre Dame, restaurants, Pantheon, Gardens etc. Public parking station nearby if you have to have a car.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible renovation”
Reviews.Author: GuilhermeThome
Reviews.Content: With new and excellent rooms, with air conditioner and luxury bathrooms, I found a new Hotel Saint Jacques. Salmon, cheeses, fresh fruits, ham, very tasty breads, yogurts, a perfect brunch is now the breakfast of Hotel Saint Jacques. Congratulations to the direction of the hotel for the renovation, that, no doubt, is the best option to stay in Paris. For me, is the only option.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Martha_2005
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful boutique hotel. Walking distance to the Metro, to Pantheon, and to Notre Dame Cathedral. The staff are simply as wonderful - Brigitte, Joe, Julian ... I had a wonderful stay an will come back again, this time with my family. Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “I would return to this verycharming hotel”
Reviews.Author: miriam40
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay at St Jaques .The triple room was very comfortable and tastefully furnished.Also the room was air conditioned and the windows double glazed which in hot weather is really important.A very good location for us showing our grandaughter Paris for the first time.I would certainly return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: azmlc
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Hotel St. Jacques in late May. The staff was very friendly and helpful with any questions that we had and storing our luggage on the last day there. The room was very clean and accomadated all our Paris needs. We were on the 6th floor which required climbing one flight of stairs since the elevator only went up to the 5th floor. They did verify before giving us the room that we were okay with stairs. The room was great and had a lovely view and small balcony. The street noise was not a problem at all for us. The only issue we had were the thin walls since it is an old building, just be prepared to here neighbors come home late. Great stay and we will definitely recommend Hotel St. Jacques!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Deise_Boy08
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Latin Quarter ideal for sight seeing trips around this wonderful city ! The hotel was clean and ideally located with helpful desk staff, The Pantheon is at the back of the hotel so its an ideal "marker" to find you way back !!! We were given a downstairs room No 39 (1 of 2 downstairs) personally I did not like it it was at street level. I requested a change which we got it the next night to a lovely room with a balcony, bright, airy, breezy and cheaper figure that out !!! You can have a wee bit of street noise in the night but it didn't bother me as we were late returning anyway ! Oh if your planning a visit to the Eiffel Tower buy your ticket online it will save you at least an hour queuing. Metro is fab and easy to use ! Would definitively recommend this hotel and Paris to fellow travelers. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “a nice hotel with a perfect service”
Reviews.Author: stephan075
Reviews.Content: the week in this hotel was very nice and relaxing. Especially the breakfast and the service were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Very Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nicolekostiuk
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed staying at your hotel. It really was a true Paris experience! Very nice big rooms and very confortable beds. The location was perfect, right in the Latin Quarter, by the shopping and lively neighbourhood. We will recomend your hotel to everyone that comes to Paris. Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, friendly staff, great location.”
Reviews.Author: thummel
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed this hotel; we were able to access our room early in the day; the staff were always friendly and helpful; this is a great location in the Latin Quarter - we could get anywhere easily and it's a wonderful neighborhood for walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for a weekend in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: v_out
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! it took us forever to decide on a place - were looking for a combination of within budget, good location and comfortable. I was thrilled by the whole experience. It's perfectly located in the Latin Quarter - close to the river but away from the super-touristy Saint Germain road, close to the restaurants and bars of the Latin Quarter but on a quiet street. The hotel itself is charming and the staff were relaxed, friendly and attentive. The room (we got a standard double) was fairly small but we had a sweet balcony and it was everything we needed for a mini-break to Paris. I suggest you ask for a room on the front of the building as they are lighter that the ones at the back. I would strongly recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: JustaDerby72
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending 4 nights in this wonderful city. The Hotel was in a fantastic location, close to many of the cities numerous attractions and very convenient for the metro etc. Although the room was small (they are in Paris) the hotel was pretty much all we hoped for and we would love to return. Oh there is a very good Mexican restaurant nearby called El Sol y La Luna if you fancy something different to French food !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, amazing breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: WinoFoodieTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Jacques is in the perfect location in Paris if you are looking for easy access to the Metro, walking distance to major sites, and great restaurant options. The staff at the hotel spoke English well and were very accommodating in assisting with dinner reservations and making recommendations on how to travel around the city. We would definitely stay at the hotel again if we ever go back to Paris. One small piece of advice, if you want a shower (where the water sprays from above your head) and not just a tub with a hand held shower head, then be sure to specify that in your room request.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service and Worse Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Weegeet
Reviews.Content: Expensive for a small room where you have to climb the last set of stairs to get to your room - Euros 125! No mirror in the bedroom either. My husband went to get us breakfast in the mornings from a shop outside, but when he asked to borrow a spoon, the hotel refused and said that it was against their policy. Well, don't offer a room only rate if you want all your guests to have breakfast in house! There was a banging noise from 7am - 11am 2 mornings in a row, but when we complained, there was no apology, but were told we could move to a room on the ground floor, but that it was more expensive than the room we were in. We went down to see it, and it was dark, with the most hideos decor. We decided to stay in the poky, but at least light, room back up stairs. The room also seemed to permanently have a large ladder outside it by the stairs, which you had to manoevre round to get down the stairs - details like this could have been avoided. Do Not stay here if you have mobility issues. Oh, and don't think of coming back after 11pm. The door is locked and when you ring the bell, they make you feel like you have got them out of bed, and are rather surly. Location may be fantastic, but they are dining out on the fact that the hotel appeared in the fil "Charade". There are so many more fantastic hotels in the same area which are nowehere near as expensive, and certainly more hospitable. As someone who works in the hotel trade, I couldn't actually believe how bad it was.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Akolei
Reviews.Content: Great charming hotel at a good location. Check-in was easy and could be done in the room. Our room (14) was a room at the corner of the building and had a small balcony with a view of the Notre Dame! We did have to deal with some street noise, but I always carry a pair of earplugs with me so it did not bother us at all. Everything you need is within walking distance of the hotel: bars, shops, restaurants, some of the great sites. Would love to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: loujoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for sighteeing. It is about 400m from the river and about 00m from Notre Dame. There are some great restaurants nearby with really good food - Le Buisson Ardent and the Petit Prince. The staff were really friendly and very obliging. The room was a bit cosy but I did not expect a big room given that it is the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Always Have Paris”
Reviews.Author: MrBoissy
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Jacques is a wonderful hotel in the midst of the Quartier Latin in the 5th arrondisement--5 minutes from the Pantheon and the Musee Cluny and 10 minutes from Notre Dame. The neighborhood was fascinating! We would rank the hotel high in terms of value, ambience, and location (we look for reasonably priced places that are comfortable and centrally located; we don't go to cities to hang out in a hotel). The lobby and our room were very attractive and the breakfast room is a real treasure. The hotel staff were OUTSTANDING--friendly and helpful. The different people at the desk went out of their way to help us with a problem (not involving the hotel), to find a nearby place for a light supper, and in securing the most convenient shuttle to the airport. We would DEFINITELY stay here again and would recommend the hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you hoped for and more!”
Reviews.Author: ButtermilkBay
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, steps to the Metro, Notre Dame, Seine. The staff was wonderful, spoke several languages, very accommodating. My husband was ill during our visit and the staff assisted us with obtaining medication, supplies and anything else we needed-we felt like we were at home! Would definately stay there again, and would recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Isabel_2
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Hotel St Jacques. It was still just as nice a hotel as it was the last time I stayed there but the price has gone up. They were having a “November promo” of 70€ x 3night = 210€ paid in advance but the normal price for a single is now 97€. If money is not an issue then definitely stay here. There are other hotels in the same area for a bit less money that are perfectly OK though. But if you want a "little" luxury this hotel has an ambiance the more budget options do not. Rooms are all ensuite very nice bathroom, TV with CNN, double bed, roomier than some European singles, lift goes to the 5th floor then walk one more flight for top floor. Tiny windows with not much view on top floor. The location is about as good as you can get – ten minutes to Place St Mich, Notre Dame, Ile st Louis.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, central location and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Hamman_10
Reviews.Content: On arrival reception immediately knew that we had enquired at the time of booking about a possible early check in. Service and assistance were super friendly and efficient at all times. Central location close to Metro and RER B train station so travelling to the Maison &Objet trade show was quick. Also close to Pantheon, Luxembourg Gardens and Notre Dame, thus ideal for an early morning stroll or jog. Room spacious and beautifully decorated for the rate that is charged. Will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “probably of the hotels I have been to in Paris over the years the most likely I would return to”
Reviews.Author: borm
Reviews.Content: Given the cost of Paris in the low value pound era and freezing weather this hotel proved to be a good base and certainly is an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Amazing Location, A True Parisian Experience”
Reviews.Author: OhioArtsygirl
Reviews.Content: This is a slightly delayed review of the Hotel St. Jacques, stayed here in Sept. 2009. If I travel to Paris again, I would definitely return to St. Jacques. This hotel exceeded all of our expectations in charm and location. This was my first trip to Paris and I will be back! In my opinion, this is really the place to be to feel all of the young energy from students at the nearby Sorbonne and excellent, affordable bistros and dinner spots all within walking distance of St. Jacques. Right down the street, we caught the Metro to shuttle us to all of the Parisian sights. What a treat it was to step out on our balcony and see Notre Dame down one street view, and then the gloriously lit Pantheon in the other direction. I would highly recommend reserving a room with the balcony, it just adds so much to the experience. Additionally, this hotel is quite close to the Rue Mouffetard, which is a quaint little street lined with shops. Also dined at Cafe Delmas and had gelato at Amorino on the square Place de la Contrescarpe. My boyfriend and I were very pleased with our room, although it was on the smaller side (this is Europe after all). It had all of the charming Parisian touches that made it a great homebase after a day of sightseeing. We loved our balcony! We stayed in a corner standard room which was at the very top floor (ride the elevator up, and then walk up one more flight). Only downside of staying at the very top was that the roof starts to angle in throughout the bathroom. This room did not have a stand-up shower, tub and handheld head only. Only complaint there would be that while I was in the bath, the water would turn from ice cold to scalding hot in a second (no exaggeration). Had good pressure, nonetheless. There are several boulangeries within walking distance on Rue des Ecoles, as well as a breakfast spot, where we ate every morning, right down the street on Rue des Carnes, on your way to the Maubert-Mutualite Metro stop. Some mentioned the antique market, which was very fun to browse. St. Jacques is also, very close to some affordable women's clothing & accessories shopping down Blvd Saint-Michel, to the west. I stopped at NafNaf & Promod. We were very pleased with the friendly service we experienced at St. Jacques, given our limited French. We arranged an airport shuttle (which i would not recommend) and the front desk was very prompt in relaying the message of when they would be arriving to pick us up. They also helped us secure dinner reservations, which again was very appreciated. Thank you, Hotel St. Jacques for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris experience in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last day of our trip to Italy and France, and it really was the perfect Parisian experience. It is elegant, charming and clean. The movie “Charade” starring Audrey Hepburn and Carey Grant was shot here – I watched it beforehand, and am happy to say while it is certainly recognizable, it is by far nicer now. The staff was not overly-friendly, but was helpful and courteous. The location is fantastic – right in the heart of the Latin quarter, within walking distance to tons of restaurants, cafes, the Seine, the Louvre, everything. There was a charming little lobby bar, a pretty breakfast room, and a lovely spiral staircase. We stayed in one of the “Deluxe Double” rooms( and received a substantial discount by paying in advance on their website – just $147 Euros, non-refundable) and it was wonderful. The furnishings were beautiful, the bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was clean and modern with a huge tub. There was a little balcony with a table and chairs, and from there we had a really nice view of the street-life below and Notre Dame in one direction and the Parthenon in the other! If you’re looking for an inexpensive meal or snack (which can be hard to find), I would absolutely recommending walking down the street a block to Boulanger Patisserie on Blvd. St. Germain (it is not yet listed on TripAdvisor, but I have submitted a request). We had an amazing French-style pizza w/ champignon for just $3.50 Euros and a fabulous French bruschette with tomato for just $2 Euro. We went to the wine store/market next door (Vins) and got a great Bordeaux for just $4 Euros, brought it all back to the room and had a wonderful lunch for 2 on our balcony for just $10Euros. We would absolutely stay here again and whole-heartedly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel near Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Bentheir
Reviews.Content: People who know how to find a good bargain stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and efficient personnel.”
Reviews.Author: arcoverus
Reviews.Content: At December 28 2009 my wife, daughter and I arrived at the St. Jacques and stayed until January 4 2010. We were pleased to find helpful, efficient personnel at the reception specially Mr. Areski. Our room for three was really a small double with an extra bed, and somewhat cramped, but considering how hard it is to find accommodations and how hotels in Paris raise prices hugely for the Year's end the situation was manageable. Bathrooms range from normal sized to tiny but are very clean and same are the rooms. Unfortunately the hotel does not have a policy of banning smoking or at least to do that for some floors and the smell of smoke passes anytime from one room to another through the air conditioning ducts . About the size of rooms, all are not the same layout hence if one draws a better one the situation gets to be much better. We loved the location, near Pantheon, Boul Mich, Pl de la Contrescarpe, Saint Germain, Seine, Notre Dame, Jardin du Luxemburg. There are very many good bistros and all kind of restaurants near by as well as all sorts of shops, a taxi stand, a metro station and even an open air market three days a week. About Paris: we have visited it many times over four decades and in spite of greedy real state developers it still keeps its beauty and charm , however the once safe New Year's Eve celebration at Champs Elysees has turned somewhat ugly because groups of people arriving from wherever gave it at times a poor atmosphere. In fact thousands of police officers in riot gear were needed there to keep things from going wild. Better to keep the celebration to parties at better places. All in all we would stay again at the St. Jacques, but at the time of making our reservation we shall be more specific about the room we prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: aiglos_br
Reviews.Content: St. Jacques is a very elegant and comfortable place to stay. Well-located, it is just some minutes walk from the Panthéon and the Notre-Dame, and has many options of restaurants and cafès around. The hotel's staff is gentle and attencious and the services provided, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: BKandE
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the St. Jacques during Christmas week. The hotel is perfectly located near two Metro lines, a block from a lovely open-air market, and two blocks from the Cluny Museum on one side and the Pantheon on the other. Many cafes nearby, and some outstanding restaurants -- among them "L'Ecurie" and "Le Petit Prince". Our room on a high floor, though cosy, was nicely decorated and had a lovely 180 view. The beds were comfortable (important for my arthritic hips) and the shower nice and strong. Free wireless internet a big plus. Desk staff varied from friendly and helpful to indifferent. Our one big quibble was that there was an unpleasant odor in our room which we traced to a fairly large patch of mold in a corner of the bedroom. When we asked for a disinfectant spray the weekend desk clerk said that nothing could be done until Monday, two days away. We went out and bought a strong product that seemed to take care of the problem, although we both came down with sinus problems while we were there. When I brought it up to the manager when we left, he promised to take of the problem.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Vacat!on
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visited Paris in November. It's a bit of a walk from the subway but the hotel is well worth the bit of travel. We booked the basic double room which is on the 6th floor. The elevator only goes to the 5th floor and then we had to walk up one flight of stairs. Our room was absolutely charming. The bathroom was clean and there was a tub which we could take baths. The water pressure was great and the water was always hot! There's no breakfast included, but it can be purchased for an extra fee. I'd by pass the breakfast and go to the bakery across the street. They have the best baked goods! The hotel is in the heart of the Latin Quarter. There's no shortage of food choices. Notre Dame is close by as well as the Pantheon. Make sure you visit the Eiffel Tower at night. There's a great light show in the evening on the hour. The Musee D'orsay was a wonderful visit. Versailles Palace was a great day trip as well. If you're in Paris for over 5 days and travelling within a week from Mon - Sun, the Navigo Decouverte pass is much cheaper than other travel passes. You can buy it at the main travel stations. The only thing is that you need to bring a small photo of yourself to put on the pass, bring a photocopy of your passport photo. I can't wait to return to Paris and the Hotel St. Jacques!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaG
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very, very small and the bathroom is ridiculously small but very, very clean. One tip would be to put a shelf in the shower. It is so small you can barely bend down to pick up soap and shampoo products. Also, it would be nice just to put a couple of hooks on the wall for robes. The shower is near the toilet so you have to leave towels and robes on the toilet. The staff is very nice, the location is fantastic and there is free Internet, which is very nice. The continental breakfast for 10 Euros is pretty overpriced. It is just coffee, orange juice, a baguet, and a couple of croissants, although they do serve eggs and cereal. I think I would rather spend a bit more and get a hotel with a more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ScottFK
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location in the Latin Quarter is very near many cafes and restaurants. It's also within easy walking distance of the Notre Dame Cathedral and public transportation (the Metro) to take you anywhere else you might want to visit. The hotel is fairly basic, and the rooms are small, but everything is very clean and well done. The staff are all friendly and helpful, and most speak very good English. The price can't be beat; this hotel offers excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Covers all bases for a stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Riandaule
Reviews.Content: This completely charming hotel is THE place to stay while in Paris! Very frenchy in decor, absolutely fabulous location, comfortable beds, lovely bathrooms, and a breakfast that makes you want to take a picture! What's more is the fact that it is one of the best priced hotels in the city! This is my second stay, and believe me, I will return! The staff will welcome you with open arms and make your stay in Paris a complete success! Choose the St. Jacques! (There is even free internet access for your laptop, and if you don't have it with you, they will lend you one of theirs!)

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, cozy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: silkroad1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in September. We're a mature couple on our first trip to Paris. Hotel ideally situated a block from of St. Germain des-Pres in the Latin Quarter. We walked to the Louve and Notre Dame. Quite room despite facing a busy corner. Well cleaned, for its age, friendly and helpful staff. Found breakfasts an average value. But don't overlook the hotel's tiny bar/sitting room off the lobby . . . .they havethe best drink prices in Paris. Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with a wonderful ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: HappyCoupleNM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three days. This was our fourth stay and fourth hotel in Paris. The Hotel St. Jacques was our favorite hotel of the four we have stayed in. We would love to visit this hotel again. All of the staff were friendly, spoke good English, and helped out as needed. The room (#23) was very romantic. We had only one breakfast in the hotel, on our last morning, and it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fl0ridatravelers
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and the location was great. Close to a lot of sites and convenient for walking. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean well located Parisian style hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJimB
Reviews.Content: Wonderful old style Parisian hotel within easy walking distance of great restaurants, sights, and metro. We were in Room 20 which was very quiet at night and had a view of Pantheon and Notre Dame. Nice clean large room. Updated bathroom. Could have used more lighting in room. Staff was very friendly and helpful for the most part. Some services, such as dry cleaning are not available at the hotel. We did not do the hotel breakfast since there were very wonderful bakeries close by. Do not miss the Coupe Chou restaurant which is a block from the hotel. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shikari
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel in the Latin Quarter. It was so close to so many things we wanted to see. The hotel has beautiful ceilings and was well maintained. The staff was nice and helpful. There were a lot of places to eat in the area. We had room #12, which is set up for 3 people. So, I found it strange it had a very small bathroom. The bathroom on our river cruise boat was probably only 1 foot smaller. You'd think a room for 3 would have a larger bathroom. But, it was clean and up-to-date. It would be nice to have a light over the desk. The walls were thin and we could hear the people next to us. But, this building is probably over 200 years old. Some have mentioned street noise making it difficult to sleep, but we did not have this problem. Although you have internet access, there is not a printer. The room, and especially bathroom, could use some hooks to hang up things. No washcloths or tissue, so bring your own if you need it. The US dollar vs Euro does make this hotel expensive, but that isn't the hotel's fault. The hotel has a lot of charm and I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel and can't wait to return to Hotel Saint Jacques”
Reviews.Author: glynnguinn
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just got back from five days in Paris. Hotel Saint Jacques was the perfect little spot in the heart of a great neighborhood. There wasn't a single thing I would change about it. Great location for walking anywhere you'd like including to the metro, great restaurants, cafes, monuments, jazz clubs, Sunday markets. The staff are extremely helpful. They have a hotel laptop that you can use for free while lounging in their lobby drinking wine. The beds were comfortable. Rooms are clean and beautifully decorated. Ask for room #8. It is a corner room with a perfect wrap-around balcony. At night we would sit and drink wine until all hours while enjoying the views of Notre Dame, the Pantheon and the locals having dinner downstairs at the cafe across the street. Friday and Saturday nights are definitely loud thanks to the college kids and younger crowd partying it up at local cafes. But enjoy and just bring ear plugs. Also, the local cafes seem to get their weekly wine and beer delivery on Wednesday mornings, so be prepared for that at 6 am! Overall, I can't think of anything I'd change. Love Hotel Saint Jacques!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but bring your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: spookykennedy
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed here for 2 nights last week after staying at the Radisson on the outskirts of Paris near his corporate offices. We loved the location -- very close to the Pantheon and within walking distance of Notre Dame, Musee Cluny, Latin Quarter, a metro and RER stop -- this is why I chose it. I head read many reviews here and elsewhere and then booked through Venere. The hotel is definately what I think of when I think of a small Parisian hotel. I wanted my husband to have that experience as well. The room was small but clean. I booked a double superior and I am not sure what double standard would have been. We were on the first floor (really 2nd floor in France) overlooking Rue des Ecoles. It was NOISY. Thank heavens we had earlplugs. Between scoooters going by at all hours, garbage trucks and loud passerbys, I wouldn't have had a wink of sleep without them and I am a deep sleeper. For the price I would say it was a good choice for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely as always”
Reviews.Author: HelloWorld008
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the St Jacques many times over the years and we have always been very happy with the quality of service we received. The staff are excellent, always pleasant and helpful and speak very good English although they are more than happy to let you try out your French. The rooms are a good size and clean, as are the bathrooms, and it's in a great location for the Pantheon, Notre Dame and the rest of the Latin Quarter. There are some very good restaurants all within a couple of minutes walk. The hotel also offers luggage storage should you arrive before the 1pm check-in time and want to get out and see the city minus your suitcases, which comes in very handy. All in all a great hotel which we plan to return to in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “History and more history”
Reviews.Author: ReginaPittsburghPa_
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Paris, (American couple 60 years of age) and we were overwhelmed by the amount of history and beauty this city has to offer. At every step, we were met with yet another historical building/museum as well as many restaurants with fabulous food. Highlights include views from Montmartre (we were fortunate to be there during their annual wine festival), the second level of the Eiffel Tower at night, and the top of the Arche de Triomphe at night. We stayed at the Hotel St. Jacques in the Latin Quarter for six nights and highly recommend it! It is a very pretty location (the movie "Charade" with Cary Grants was filmed there), very friendly and efficient,, extremely clean, great breakfasts, and helpful front desk: just a 2 minute walk to the subway station Maubert and 5 more minute walk to Notre Dame.There are excellent restaurants in the area and a wonderful outdoor market with various vendors. I needed to see a doctor due to a sinus/ear infection and the front desk called for one to visit me at the hotel. The physician arrived within 5 minutes! He examined me and gave me three prescriptions which I filled at a pharamacie (there is one on every corner) and I was able to continue on with my trip. We can now check Paris off our "bucket list" with great joy and memories!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KMartin2
Reviews.Content: Great location. Helpful staff. Our room was on the very top floor and we enjoyed the view from the small balcony. Can be noisey at times. I got a kick out of staying where the movie "Charade" was filmed, although the hotel has been renovated since the movie was filmed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Paris Pretty”
Reviews.Author: HoosierGirl09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and very pretty and charming...feels like Paris! Breakfast not included and we never tried. The staff was great and helpful and even let us use the laptop for free to get on the internet. They also had water bottles for us at night when we came home (we had to ask for them) Small lift, we used the winding staircase. The location was the only thing that would keep us from staying here again - didn't feel very central to where we wanted to be. We like Rue de Buchi because it had more restaurant and market choices. But not a terrible location - worth taking a taxi from the train stop because it's a bit of a walk and sort of confusing to find. Shower a little weird - it's a handheld showerhead so a little hard to shower, but not awful.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable room with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: miketrish
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in Paris to celebrate our 39th anniversary. Really enjoyed the friendly service from all the staff whose English was far better than our French! Our room was more spacious than we expected in Paris and bathroom very adequate. The location is very convenient -only 10 min walk to the Seine and one street away from open top bus tour stops. Many restuarants in the area. Good value for money-we would definitely return. Mike and Trish Smith

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Alexandria-family
Reviews.Content: We liked the Hotel St Jacques because the staff were very helpful. We were traveling with my 85 year old mother who was using a wheel chair and they had a room in which she was very comfortable, complete with walk in shower. The staff went out of their way to find a room that suited her. The thing we did not like about Paris was that many places were not wheelchair accessible, including the metro. This made it very hard to get around. The Hotel St Jacques was in a great location allowing us to walk to Notre Dame, the Pantheon (not wheelchair accessible) and many restaurants. Luckily, there is an elevator at the Eiffel Tower, and the staff there saw us in line, and brought us to the head of a different line where we did not have to wait long to go up the tower. My mother really enjoyed doing that as she thought she would not be able to go up the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay In Paris”
Reviews.Author: AdvTrv
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Jacques provided the perfect setting to base our trip to Paris. While the room was cozy, quaint and exceptionally clean, the hotel's location was fabulous for taking in all of the sites of Paris and also provided quick access to wonderful cafes, restaurants and local markets. The staff was outstanding and beyond helpful when it came to requests, recommendations and accommodations. Honestly, we could not have asked for a better place to stay. From price to service - it was fabulous. We would fully recommend Hotel St. Jacques to anyone planning a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Value with lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: RideMeToTheMoon
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this very chaming, boutique hotel. First and foremost, the location was excellent...walking distance to most of the sights we wanted to see...Notre Dame, The Louvre, Musee de Orsay, etc. The room was very large and clean. We had small balconies overlooking the street and the view was gorgeous! Overall, the hotel is a little run-down, but in a very charming way. The only drawback was that the shower head was hand-held, which made washing a bit of a challenge. There are several great restaurants very close by that I also have to recommend. First, the best espresso on earth is served at the Bistro directly next to the hotel, Le Petite Perigourdine. Divine! There's also a great restaurant called, Brasserie Balar within walking distance. I would stay here again in a heartbeat and highly recommend it for the traveler looking for an authenic, charming, Paris hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a romantic break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vr6S40
Reviews.Content: I could not tell you anything bad about this hotel. It was great!! We stayed three nights in June and had the best time. We'd stayed here previously in November 2008 and really enjoyed this stay too! It's no four star hotel but its a perfect place to see Paris from. We had a room on the top floor with a balcony that stretched right around the building giving views of Notre Dam and the Pantheon. The Hotel staff even recommended a place to go and eat just around the corner and we ate there both nights. I usually prefer to go to different places but this resturant was so damn good!! The breakfast room is great, quirky and amusing. The food was good and the coffee lovely. The price is so reasonable for the location and quality. I could not recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTee
Reviews.Content: Hosts were wonderfully helpful with respect to making sure all accomodations were perfect. Very charming decor, great location near Latin Quarter and only 5 minute walk from Notre Dame Cathedral 3 minute walk from metro. Shower was awesome!!! Only thing that was lacking was good recommendations for good hotspots for a young traveller but i can't complain about that one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cost/benefit ratio, nice bathroom, near Notre-Dame and Seine”
Reviews.Author: CONQUERERMTM
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time and will definitely return with my wife next year. Brigitte and other hotel team members were always very attentive - they have a bar in the lobby and we can use their notebook with free Internet access for 30 minutes (or even more) each day! My room was not so spacious because it was a single room, with double bed, though. I got a room with no view to the Rue de Ecoles. Only double and triple rooms have a good view. It didn't bother me too much because I was in Paris to visit all the places in only 7 days, not to appreciate the view....:) Location is very nice : a 10-minute walk from Notre-Dame and the Seine, Metro stations nearby, very near the Pantheon. Bathroom was wonderful : clean and spacious! Shower, in particular, was by far the best of my five hotels in Europe these three weeks. Summarizing, I felt good spending 7 days at St. Jacques.....recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Rambler4
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable, non-pretentious, small hotel with an excellent location on the Left Bank. We walked everywhere from here. There are wonderful cafes nearby with friendly service. We felt like we were at home and will return to Hotel St. Jacques on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem of a hotel in the centre of Paris and near the Metro”
Reviews.Author: Hughesfour
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect place to spend 2 days in the centre of Paris. It is not far from the Metro and we had a top floor side room but our small balcony looked out onto Notre Dame in the distance- perfect! Although there was a road near by the rooms seemed almost sound proofed- we had no problems with noise at all and the very comfy, huge bed made for a good night's sleep-much needed after all of our walking! Our room was lovely although in typical french style- no tea/coffee making facilities-is it only the Brits that do this in our hotels? The bathroom was complete with a marble sink unit and a bath with shower- no problems there. The added bonus was the room was air conditioned which, again, made it easier to sleep. The whole experience in this hotel was great even if it was only a place to rest our tired feet. The only negative was the breakfast- very expensive for what you got so we only ate in the hotel once. If you are looking for a huge selection of food then don't bother- cereal was in one of those small packets you get in the variety packs from the supermarket and the yoghurt was simply a pot which we could have bought ourselves at a supermarket and eaten much more cheaply in our room! Much better to breakfast in the many brasseries near by. Another thing, just at the back of the hotel was a host of small restaurants and we would recommend L'Ecurie on rue de la Montagne Ste-Genevieve (very old and small but great atmosphere-watch the toilet though- is a hole in the floor!) Also recommend Le Florimond restaurant near Eiffel Tower at Motte-Picquet (very traditional and decent toilets!)

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: nylon21
Reviews.Content: The hotel St. Jacques was a perfectly fine choice in a good location on the left bank (latin quarter), especially for the price of 140 euros per night. we had a room on the 5th floor (top floor) with a balcony which we requested. they didn't guarantee the balcony but were able to give it to us when we checked in so we were very happy. the room itself was a decent size, it was sort of long and narrow-- there wasn't a lot of room to move around one side and the foot of the bed, but the other side had lots of room. the view from the balcony (notre dame and the pantheon) was really beautiful. the bed was very firm and comfortable with extra pillows in the closet. the air conditioning worked great and kept the room nice and cool. negatives: the room was very dark, especially the bathroom, even with all the lights on in the middle of the day. it was hard for me to see enough to do my makeup. the hairdryer resembled a vaccuum cleaner hose attached to the wall and did not work well-- i've seen this kind of hairdryer in low/moderate-price hotels before, so it's not unique to the st. jacques. but you'll definitely want to bring your own. when other guests are in the hallway, they sound like they're in the room with you. but once they go in their room, you don't hear them through the walls. it was just annoying when other guests would get up early to go sightseeing and wake us up. finally, the concierge was not very knowledgeable or did not seem eager or comfortable to make restaurant recommendations. on the first night, we asked for dinner suggestions and they gave us one, which we walked to and didn't look great. but right across the street from that one, we saw another (le coupe chou) which was amazing-- highly recommended. the next night we did our own research and had some names of restaurants in other neighborhoods we wanted the concierge to call for us to verify they were open. the guy at the front desk was hesitant/reluctant/annoyed to do so, but eventually did and got us a table at our top choice. overall i would recommend this hotel if the price is very important to you, because it's comfortable and convenient for a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessential French Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BeckiBoo24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so lucky to find this hotel. We had not made reservations prior to coming to Paris and thought we would "wing it" somewhere in the Latin Quarter/West Bank. We happened upon Hotel Saint Jacques and absolutely loved it. Joe at the front desk was most helpful in helping us arrange a river cruise and assisted with all our other needs. This is a great location, good air conditioning, free wi-fi access, good water pressure in the shower. It was really quaint and reasonably priced. We would recommend this hotel as well as stay here again. Also a great little brasserie on the corner (same side of the street) that had wonderful food!

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: DolcePittsburgh
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Saint Jaques is a very confortable and cozy place to stay. It is well situated and the staff is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: ita360
Reviews.Content: pros: location, quiet, clean, good beds, helpful staff, 24hr reception, free use of laptop, has a lot of character, near metro, good a/c (only important because the street is too loud to keep windows open at night and on our trip the temp was in the mid 90s), cons:??? can't think of any If you can fit it in your budget (it was a little expensive for us about $160) stay here! It is a great hotel in a great location

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Saint Jacques, located in the heart of Paris' Latin Quarter was a perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: jkklo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our daughter and her friend to France to celebrate her high school graduation and 18th birthday. We had only two and a half days to spend in Paris and, after much frantic last minute searching on the internet to find hotel accomodations, were incredibly lucky to find the last two rooms at the Hotel Saint Jacques. Located in the heart of the lovely Latin Quarter, it is within easy walking distance of everything we could have hoped for: Metro/train stations; cafes/bars/restaurnats; the banks of the Seine; and Il del la Cite/Notre Dame. The neighborhood was a pleasure in and of itself, and the hotel turned out to be everything we were hoping for. It is very much a traditional French hotel -- not for anyone looking for an American-style hotel experience. That being said, it had every modern convenience we could have asked for, but was still lovely and quaint and understated. I really believe it was an excellent value, in that I might have expected to pay much, much more for such a lovely hotel experience. The management was also very accomodating when we had an airline flight snafu which caused our arrival to be delayed by one full day. In short, we would be delighted to stay at the Hotel Saint Jacques the next time we are lucky enough to find ourselves in Paris, and we would recommend it 'without reservation' to anyone who is looking for a quintessential French hotel experience at a most reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice for a Paris hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dsandtiaah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel St. Jacques for 5 nights with my 17 year old daughter. We could not have made a better choice. This is a lovely, charming hotel in an excellent location. We stayed in a small room with 2 twin beds. The room was beautifully decorated in the classic French style. It was perfectly clean. We were able to walk almost everywhere. If not, the Metro and RER were just a few blocks away. Although we were on the busy Rue des Ecoles, we didn't hear any noise at night thanks to the double paned windows. The staff was extremely friendly, helpful and spoke English very well. They recommended a fabulous restaurant, Le Petit Prince de Paris, one block away. We had the most delicious meal of our 3 week trip here. We will definitely return to the St. Jacques.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerFromToronto
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in room #2 on the 2nd floor of the Hotel St. Jacques in late June/early July and had a pleasant stay. Room was of a decent size, had a very quaint decor and, more importantly, had an excellent working air conditioner which my always-too-warm husband appreciated. A/C was quiet, had a digital thermostat with high and low fan setting and individually controlled per room. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, all seemed to speak English well enough. They helped us to book a shuttle to take us to the airport. Location was great. Close to metro station and lots of restaurants. Within walking distance to the Notre Dame, Pantheon and Luxembourg gardens. Groceries, ATM, and everything you need nearby. The walls aren't very thick and we heard people in the adjoining rooms once (as they were loud) and a fair amount of noise in the morning (we're not early risers) from inside and outside the hotel but it wasn't a big problem for us. We did have to pick up and drop of keys at the check-in desk in the lobby every time we came back and left the hotel. They always keep the keys to the room and this also wasn't a problem for us. Our photos of this hotel are posted at http://travel.webshots.com/album/573356922nkPuFU

Reviews.Title: “Fantistic Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Yogues
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent five nights in room 26 on the fifth floor at Hotel St. Jacques June 26 - July 1 and had a wonderful time. The room is a Deluxe Double (189 Euros per night) with a nice queen size bed, a small closet, safe, a couple of desks and a small sitting area. The bathroom is small but has a large tub with hand held shower and new fixtures. One person at a time but very nice. My favorite part of the room was the balcony from which we could see Notre Dame to the right and the Pantheon to the left. Though the Hotel offers breakfast, we went to a different cafe every day, and there is no shortage within easy walking distance from the hotel. One block off of Avenue St. Germain and three blocks from the Seine at Notre Dame, the location can't be beat. Though the street can been noisy, the windows are pretty much sound proof so we slept well through the night. Air conditioning was a welcome bonus as the weather was hot a sunny for our entire stay. I would definitely (and already have) recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little gem”
Reviews.Author: insightable
Reviews.Content: A comfortable, charming, character hotel in a great central location. The room was tastefully decorated with a renovated bathrom and the shuttered balcony just completed the whole Paris feel. You are walking distance to everything including the train station which takes you to the airport. This is a real bonus! Staff were most hospitable. The only criticism was that the lovely breakfast room was in a cellar with an additional cost for breakfast which was highly overpriced and therefore not utilised. Consequently everyone just went across the road to the local cafe.

Reviews.Title: “It's a beautiful, convenient hotel, with the friendliest, most helpful service.”
Reviews.Author: auntmame
Reviews.Content: My niece and I were in Paris for the first time, to celebrate her graduation from law school, so it was very important for our hotel to be a comfortable, convenient base. The St. Jacques certainly met the bill. And the staff were very helpful and very friendly. They met all our needs. Based on what I've seen online for the rates for other hotels, the St. Jacques is very good value and I'd be very happy to return. It's a charming, lovely place and I have no qualms at all in recommending it! (There isn't a restaurant, but they do serve breakfast and you can also use room service to get your breakfast.)

Reviews.Title: “happy here”
Reviews.Author: stegger7
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded for some reason and loved our spacious 4th floor room,much bigger than we expected and views to the street from two windows.Location is very ,very the best in Paris for transport access to Metro or CDG. Also great cafes and nightlife nearby,yet still quiet at night for sleeping. We paid 110E per night and this was good value with free inet access in room and good shower,and inroom safe.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, best of everything, I'd live here if I could!”
Reviews.Author: TJ1LA
Reviews.Content: On my recent trip to Paris (spent time living here too, so I'm familiar with the city), I stayed in 4 different hotels. The Saint Jacques was my favorite of the four. The neighborhood is perfect; a short walk down the hill to the nearest Metro; close to St. Michel and Notre Dame but just far enough away that you can escape the student and tourist traffic if you want to. A short walk up the hill to the Panthéon and the church of Saint Etienne du Mont, resting place of St Genevieve, patron saint of Paris! The lobby of the hotel is lovely and very welcoming. Friendly staff and they even have a computer you can use to check your email. I paid 97 euros for a single on the second floor, room 37. A great price for a nice hotel in this area and I felt it was more than worth it. Similar hotels in this neighborhood can easily be twice as expensive and I was so pleased to get this kind of a hotel room and service for under 100 euros. I loved my room although if they hadn't been sold-out I would've loved a room up high with a nice view. But no complaints as my room was breezy and quiet. The room was spacious (relative to similar hotel rooms in this price category), beautifully furnished, nice flat-screen tv, desk, plenty of room for suitcases. Everything was very clean and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was very nice! Shower was small, as was expected, but I loved the sliding doors and it was largest bathroom I'd experienced so I was thrilled. It was a pleasure to come home to this hotel room and I plan on staying here again when I return to Paris. The Saint Jacques is my new favorite hotel in Paris! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Must Stay Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: klondono
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. We stayed in room 29 on the 6th floor for 4 days in Paris. This hotel has all the best combinations: great location (aprox 1 1/2 blocks from Maubert-Mutualite train station, close to all major sites) beautiful decor, friendly staff, our room had a beautiful balcony overlooking the rue des ecoles and PLUS: IT'S AFFORDABLE! We felt very safe walking back each night. We definitely recommend this hotel and we are sure to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in AMAZING location!”
Reviews.Author: natsea
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris about 10 times and I always stay in this area (between the Pantheon and the Seine). This was the first time I stayed at Hotel St Jacques and I liked it for it's great location, comfortable room, balconies that look out on the nightlife of the city and comfortable beds. It was clean and the bathroom was very nice. I had room #14 and you can see both the rooftops of the Pantheon and Notre Dame from your balcony in that room. However, across the street was a popular restaurant that had live music until 2 AM, so I had to sleep with earplugs. But, that's probably typical of most neighborhoods, especially one as popular as the Latin Quarter. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GlennSo_California
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and find it more charming each time I arrive. It is a beautiful small hotel, decorated with wonderful antiques. The rooms are also very beautiful and comfortable and have beautiful baths, etc. It is centrally located and close to all the tourists sites. The staff is most helpful with all your needs. I would recomment it most highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: aase
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in the Latin Quarter. No complains!

Reviews.Title: “larger room, free wifi, walking distance to practically everything”
Reviews.Author: bostonbased
Reviews.Content: We generally enjoyed our stay, with free wifi and stand-up shower a plus, but the tiny shower stall only fits people under 200 lbs (if you want to wash your feet). Room 7 includes a small couch with table in addition to the desk, so there is plenty of space, plus high ceilings. None of the rooms have bureaus, but there are 2 shelves in the closet, along with a small safe. If you are a light sleeper, this may not be the ideal spot, but we slept ok despite the accelerating scooters outside our window at the traffic light and the hallway noises (not too bad but no soundproofing at the door). The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel breakfast appeared to include pre-packaged (not fresh) pastries and the breakfast room was understaffed the day we considered having breakfast there, so for 10 euro per person we chose to skip the hotel wait and go to various bakeries nearby for fresh croissants/coffee for less money and a shorter wait. The elevator was another plus, and the room was beautifully painted. The "double" bed was 2 twins pushed together but it wasn't uncomfortable at all, as 1 large mattress pad/sheet covered both twin beds, along with 1 large top sheet and large blankets. RER from CDG into Paris worked fine- walkable distance to hotel from RER stop St. Michel/Notre Dame as well as Metro stop Maubert Mutualite; buying “carnet” of metro tickets was handy throughout the vacation; walking along the Seine from the hotel was marvelous, and we walked to the Musee d’Orsay and the Louvre from the hotel. World’s greatest gyro wrap at a small greek (?) place in a brightly lit & crowded alley near St. Michel metro stop- think the sandwich was called a doner; didn’t get a receipt- we never felt unsafe anywhere in this area, even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SaMMorris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met our friends here after being in Italy and had the best time ever! They were so accommodating and gave us rooms next to each other that were very charming. Our room had a cute non working fireplace with a big window, and our friends room had 2 large windows that looked out onto the street. The beds were really clean and very comfortable. The whole hotel was decorated beautifully and I loved the spiral staircase. The reception staff were really friendly, helpful and spoke fluent English. The location was also really great, in the heart of the Latin Quarter with the metro just down the street and the Luxembourg Gardens a few blocks away. There was also a great Italian restaurant that we went to twice just across the street. All the sights were easy to get to and we would definitely stay here again, we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little Hotel in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: ElisabethD
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 3 nights at this lovely little Hotel a short distance from Notre Dame Cathedral and many other attractions. It is a 5 min. walk from a Metro station and a short walk to the Batobus which is an affordable water taxi which can take you to most major points of interest in the City. Upon arrival at the Hotel we discovered that we had a room on the ground floor on the main street. We were concerned and disappointed unti we saw the room. It is the largest room in the Hotel and has a great double sinked, granite bathroom with a walk-in shower. The windows were double paned in thick glass and we could barely hear any outdoor noise. No problems sleeping at night! The Hotel is also within walking distance of many affordable great restaurants. One not to be missed is L'Ecurie. Great steak/frites in an old stable. We would definitely return to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book single room”
Reviews.Author: meowsako
Reviews.Content: Single room for $97E was an attick without much light and no elevator to the floor. You have to carry your suitcase on a small spiral staircase yourself = no help whatsoever. I didn't see twin rooms downstairs, but I did not like the dark attick. Especially, I was coming from sunny Tunisia, hotel with ocean view, I felt bad.

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Vieux Paris”
Reviews.Author: lightnin051
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel St. Jacques to be perfectly charming - a taste perhaps of what Paris was like before the sixties. Located on the corner of Rue des Ecoles and Carmes in the Latin quarter, there are plenty of restaurants, bars and markets within a three block radius. The Seine, Notre Dame and the Isle de la Cité are a mere half-mile walk. There is a small bar in the lobby and often a cute, impeccably dressed old man at the desk, straight out of central casting. An almost impossibly tiny (for more than two) elevator never fails to thrill when it jumps about upon reaching your floor (I wouldn't change it). Our room, a double with a queen-sized bed (the largest I saw in Europe) was very comfortable, with hand-painted frescoes on the ceiling and one wall. The bathroom was large and beautifully appointed in marble. The only thing I don't get is the European fixation on these stupid hand-held shower heads - impossibly awkward and messy. There was a flat-screen TV but we never actually turned it on. The Rue des Ecoles can be a bit noisy. The first two days we were there, they were repaving the street! That should not be a problem for a long time in the future, but I would ask for a room on the back side of the hotel if possible. Another thing I would like to mention. We discovered through some friends that live there, that there is more than one menu, and more than one price in the bars and restaurants. You will pay more for food and drinks sitting down outside, often less inside, less if you sit a the bar and even less if you belly-up and stand for your drink. I paid 9 Euros for a large beer at a sidewalk cafe - less than half that sitting at the bar. We agree with another reviewer about the Twickenham restaurant on nearby Rue St. Germain. Try the Croque Twickenham or the Dejuner Anglais. The service was always friendly. They supplied us with a bucket of ice on a couple of occasions - the first I'd seen in three weeks in Europe. When we checked out, they allowed us to store our bags for the day as we were not leaving until evening. To top it off, we discovered after arriving home, that we'd left our adapter, camera battery charger and extra battery there. I wrote them, they found it and are mailing it to us. Above and beyond. The Hotel St. Jacques will always be our place in Paris in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice and the best location”
Reviews.Author: Cambrico
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated, near the Pantheon and Notre Dame. You can walk to the Pantheon and from it reach the Luxembourg Gardens. The Mauber Mutualité Metro station is near, as well as the St.Michel Notre Dame Station, when you can take the RER to Orly or Charles de Gaulle. The Boulevard St. Germain is just one block down the street. We loved our location and all the markets, restaurants, nearby attractions , including Notre Dame and the Seine river. The room was comfortable and big when compared with other hotels. The bathroom was also very comfortable. We enjoyed a good wi fi connection, a clean room, good beds, good air conditioning system. The personnel at the reception desk were allways kind and helpful. The only reasons I don't give the excellent rating is because the breakfast was mediocre ( but this is optional and you have hundreds of options in all the Latin quarter), the TV was outdated and minuscule, and some of the furniture requires maintenance (new paint). We took the RER from Charles de Gaulle to St Michel Notre Dame at 8,40 euros per person. The way back we requested a taxi, that cost 56 euros. Both take similar time but at the end of the journey we just didn`t want to carry luggage through stairs and metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “I adore this hotel, for many, many reasons!!!!”
Reviews.Author: teachergirl07
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Hotel St. Jacques. On both trips, I traveled with family members and had more than one room. From the moment I set foot in this hotel, I loved it. The staff is extremely helpful, pleasant and knowledgeable. The rooms are very clean and delightfully decorated. On both occasions we had balconies in the rooms and a lovely view of the rue des Ecoles. The breakfasts are very good and the waitress in the breakfast room is very helpful and efficient. The location of the hotel is wonderful with some very good restaurants and cafes within walking distance. The metro is very close by as are shops and grocery stores. Not far from the St. Jacques there is a market (few mornings a week )which sells food, clothing, jewelry, and house wares. I recommended the Hotel St. Jacques to friends who stayed there last year. For some Americans, the rooms might seem a bit small but my friends did not think that was an issue. The elevator is quite small so a very large American with a very large suitcase might have a little trouble but the staff is so nice they would be right there to help. I am going back to Paris in July and, of course, I have booked a room at the St. Jacques!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerrymonkey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights over Easter. Room was on 5th floor (superior double) with a balcony. Room was a decent size and actually had a spare single bed. All very clean as was the bathroom. The view from the balcony was of the street (so no view of Pantheon I'm afraid). The location is excellent. Right in the Latin Quarter with loads of restaurants near by. It's very convenient for the airport as the RER station is a few minutes away. The RER B goes direct from CDG to St Michel notredame. Staff are friendly and have excellent English. We were very grateful of an umbrella on a rainy Saturday evening. So I would very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but must be better options nearby.”
Reviews.Author: Toondawg
Reviews.Content: This is a delayed review, but I made detailed notes of my travels and those are what I base the review upon. I chose this hotel for my first trip to Paris, since it was in a good area and rather inexpensive. The Latin Quarter is my favorite area, so the location is excellent. Close by is the Sorbonne,a police station, and two laundromats/laveries. A short walk to patisseries, corner stores, etc, can't complain about location. Though it is a slight walk to a "major" metro station, there's nothing wrong with a leisurely walk through Paris! This hotel advertised as being part of the movie "Charade" and had photos of Audrey Hepburn, but little of that charm remained. The lift was tiny but we still used it since the stairs up were uneven. The shower was tiny. In Europe I expect small showers, but this took the cake. The drainage of the sink and shower were very bad. The shower filled with water and flooded if you used it too long! But since it was so small we didn't want to stay there for long anyway, but that's no excuse for such poor drainage. The beds were very low and rather uncomfortable (rather ragged, too). The breakfast was not included in the rate, which was appalling since even if you get it (we tried it once) it was 9-10 euro for a really weak breakfast. Save your money as we did and just go to a nearby bakery. For the price, the management could have done the same and delivered superb pastries, etc and still made money. We paid 130 euro per night, which wasn't bad for the location, but there must be better hotels in the area. Rue des Ecoles is a lovely street, with many other options to stay. I would not go here again.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel in a location that you struggle to beat”
Reviews.Author: The_happy_racegoer
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in Paris and the Hotel St Jacques was perfect for what we wanted and how much we paid. The positives It has real character with lots of pieces of art, attractive balconies and little touches that you would simply not expect for the money you pay The location is a real advantage being close to the Metro, some great places to eat and drink in the Latin Quarter and St Germain a few minutes walk away. We would recomend dinner at Le Pre Verre with the Parsley ice cream and strawberries for desert! The rooms are really clean and the bathroom a decent enough size for a Paris Hotel. The front desk service is always exclellent, very friendly, understated and relaxed. We arrived before the check in time but they had a room ready for us. The funky piano at breakfast! go and see Negatives There really arent many so these are more obseravtions The breakfast was nice but the guy who waited on was bordering on rude. A chap came in after us and he clearly ignored him whilst we cleaned some tables. If we were staying again I would go to the boulangerie over the road....very nice One from my wife....only a mirror in the bathroom! Overall This is a little treasure of a place and given the location, service and character we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Until we meet again!”
Reviews.Author: Beth19
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel St. Jacques for eight nights at the end of March, and it was just about perfect. We actually stayed in more than one room because she had a friend visit during the middle of our trip. Charming is not sufficient to describe the ambiance of this small boutique hotel. Our first room, number 35, was on two levels, making it unique and fun. The bathroom is near the room's entrance, and then you climb a flight of stairs up to a sort of loft bedroom. It has been recently decorated, and elegantly refurbished. If you don't like to climb up and down stairs, or if you can't, then don't stay in this room. The stairs in this room are shiny wood and can be slippery in socks - go barefoot or wear shoes. Next we had a triple - number 18 - and it was spacious and attractive, with a nice shower. Our final room was number 23, on the fifth floor to the front, and it had a large bed, and a newly done bathroom with a great soaking tub. Although two of our rooms were facing the Rue des Ecoles, the double glazed windows made them nearly soundproof. The intricate plasterwork of the ceilings and moldings provided the icing on the cake to complete the charming ambiance. This hotel has a fabulous location. It is one block from the Maubert Mabillon Metro stop, and just around the corner from the Sorbonne. It is on the corner of Rue de Carmes, and if you stand on this corner and look up the hill you are awed by the sight of the dome of the Pantheon, just two blocks away. The staff is excellent, friendly and most accomodating. The hotel is spotlessly clean, and our rooms were always made up impeccably. The free wireless internet in the rooms worked flawlessly. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be going back to the Hotel St. Jacques!!”
Reviews.Author: GATraveljunkies
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous week at the Hotel St. Jacques. We are fans of the movie Charade, and sought out the hotel specifically. We weren't disappointed! As many of the reviews say, the hotel is in a great location, its very cute, and the service is wonderful. The staff were very accomodating and friendly. We were in room #15 on the third floor and it was very quiet and comfortable. We had room service for a continental breakfast a couople of monings, and it was delivered right on time and was a great way to start the day and really no more expensive than croissant, juice and coffee at one of the local cafes. When (not if!) we get back to Paris, we will definitely stay at the Hotel St. Jacques. Also, the hotel has high-speed internet access available in its rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Paul5795
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two children traveled to Paris and stayed at the St. Jacques while our children were on spring break from their University studies. We very much enjoyed our six day stay in Paris and at the St. Jacques. The hotel is in a great location in the Latin Quarter of Paris, which is the oldest part of the city just up from the Seine and built over the ancient Roman ruins. It was easy to get from the Charles De Gaulle Airport to the St. Jacques via the RER B commuter train directly into the Latin Quarter. From the reading I did, I think the train is the most inexpensive (8.5 Euros), and perhaps the fastest, way to get into Paris from the Airport. We did miss the closest stop (St Michel – Notre Dame station) to the St Jacques when we failed to realize that the train doors did not open automatically, but required the press of a button. Still, it took us only about ten minutes to walk to the hotel from the very next stop (Luxembourg station). Two other words of caution. First, if you plan to return to the Airport from the hotel by train, buy your return ticket when you first fly into Paris, as the ticket machines in downtown Paris did not take currency or our credit cards, and so we had to find a live ticket seller (which we eventually did). Second, when planning our Paris trip, I did not immediately realize that there were two Paris hotels both with “St Jacques” in the name and both in the Latin Quarter. Make sure when doing your research, including booking and locating, that you focus on the Hotel St Jacques located at 35 Rue de Ecoles! From the hotel it is only about a 400 meter walk downhill (through some twisty streets) to the Seine and the “Isle de La Cite” with the Notre Dame Cathedral. The Pantheon is only about a 300 meter walk uphill from the hotel in the opposite direction. The Cluny museum of mediaeval art is also only about a 300 meter walk from the hotel. Additionally, the hotel is only one block (maybe 100 meters) from the Maubert-Mutualite metro stop -- and the Metro can take you virtually anywhere else in Paris you might want to go for very little money. As mentioned in other reviews, the St. Jacques has a very decorative motif with paintings, heavy wall hangings and curtains, and a few sculptured busts. My wife and I stayed in Room 15, a deluxe double (the highest of St Jacques’ three classifications for its double rooms) located toward the back of the Hotel on the 3d floor. Our kids stayed in room 18, a triple located on the 4th floor. Our double room was rectangular and measured about 23 feet by 10 feet, which makes it maybe average size for a US hotel room but big I think for a Paris hotel room. We had plenty of room for our luggage, and a nice sitting area with a daybed/couch. The bed was nice and firm, the way I like it. We had a nice flat screen TV and an in-room safe, and the Wi-Fi worked very well. The room had two very nice large and bright windows. Of course, it was winter time, and I had heard that some apartments in Paris are not well insulated. While it got down to about freezing during the night during our stay, the thermostat in our room worked fine and we were plenty warm. The bathroom had obviously been refurbished recently, and it was very nicely done in marble and tile. It wasn’t very big, but wasn’t impossibly small either. It had a bathtub in it, and the only complaint we had about the bathroom was that the faucet, which was placed at the end of a six foot long flexible hose, had only one wall attachment and that was placed at about knee level. There was no corresponding wall attachment at a higher level, so that you couldn’t really set up the faucet as a shower head. That sort of attachment would have been nice for those of us who prefer showers. This was a very minor inconvenience, however. The kids room (the triple) was about the same size, but their bathroom was smaller with a tiny shower. One thing I should mention was that although other reviews of the St. Jacques have mentioned views of the Pantheon or Notre Dame, if you want any view you have to ask for the top floor, that is, the fifth floor. Our rooms, on the third and fourth floors, respectively, had nice windows but no view. The maids did a good job making up the room, including cleaning up the crumbs from our “picnics” (see below). Do make sure you put out the “please service” card on your doorknob in the morning when you want the room made up. On most days, we had good room service. One day when we forgot to put out the “please service” card our room was not made up. We ate breakfast at the hotel a couple of mornings and it was OK, with the continental breakfast (coffee, orange juice, and various pastries) going for 10 Euros and, with the addition of some cold cheese and ham, going for 11.5 Euros. But we discovered that you could get a slightly better breakfast for cheaper at other nearby restaurants. For example, we had a great English style breakfast at the Le Twickenham (just one block down to St Germaine Blvd and then one block over to the left ) that included fried eggs and ham, bread, coffee, and juice, all for only 8 Euros. We generally ate lunch near whatever sightseeing were doing. After two significant meals for breakfast and lunch each day, we then usually had a light picnic for dinner in our room. You can buy fresh fruit, crackers, cheese, and wine from one of several small grocery stores within a two block radius of the hotel. One grocery store, called “Proxi,” just down towards St. Germaine Blvd, was open late just about every day, until at least 9 PM. There are loads of cafes and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We ate dinner one night at Ristorante Il Pescatore, an Italian restaurant right across the street, and it was good. We had lunch one day at the Café just down the street on the corner of Rue St. Genevieve, and it was good. We also had dinner one night at a vegetarian restaurant, Le Grenier de Notre Dame, almost right across the river from the cathedral at 18 rue Bûcherie. We found the Le Grenier from a website called Tom’s guide (google “Tom” and “guide” and “Paris”). On his website, Tom reviews quite a few restaurants, many within a five minute walk of St. Jacques. The St. Jacques is in the middle of the Parisian University district just a block or so from part of the Sorbonne campus. Other reviewers on Trip Advisor have mentioned student-related noise from the street late at night. We did not hear anything much in our Room 15, located on the back side of the hotel, but our children, in Room 18 located on the front side of the hotel, did hear some student noise but they said it didn’t bother them. Of course, this may be more of a problem in warmer months when the windows are open. Interestingly, while we were out walking two evenings we did see police in riot gear and long lines of parked police vehicles immediately adjacent to the Sorbonne, but they all seemed to be just waiting around. Then, one afternoon, as we were walking near the Cluny museum, we saw an active student protest blocking an intersection in all four directions. My wife was worried about this, but as the Parisians around us just calmly went about their business I said let’s stay and watch. After a few minutes some mortorcycle policemen arrived and the demonstration broke up peacefully. The St. Jacques desk staff was efficient and friendly, and the three of them we interacted with spoke English. The only thing we really needed from them during our stay was a 220 adapter prong for our laptop computer, and they quickly came up with one of those.
