OK, this review was kind of long, but if you are still reading, then let me sum it up by stating that we very much enjoyed the St. Jacques and if we come back to Paris will likely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location; pleasant front desk service; worth a repeat visit.”
Reviews.Author: wpdame3
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the St. Jacques and it will not be our last. Very close to the Metro (Maubert-Mutualite). There is no restaurant, but who needs one in the heart of the Left Bank? The Italian restaurant across the street (Il Pescatore) is a gem - great food, efficient service and very reasonable prices. There is no laundry or dry cleaning service, but you will find a quick same-day service less than a block away on the Rue Des Carmes. All of this combines to make a well-priced bargain among hotels in Paris and, especially the Left Bank. Don't let the two star rating fool you. This is a well appointed, comfortable place to call home during your stay. The only possible drawback is that the maid service can be a little slow in arriving during the day, but a request to the front desk received prompt attention. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “lovely clean well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: criskros
Reviews.Content: We had a superior double and triple room both good. Breakfast was excellent and good value.Just around the corner from the Pantheon and an easy walk to Notre Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location...Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: 4StarSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Superior Double, room 416, for 5 nights...very ample and comfortable room ...enough space for 2 adults with too much luggage...2 sets of French Doors for light and fresh air...a supremely comfortable bed with extra pillows...the bathroom was modern, and larger than anticipated, with ample storage for toiletries...the staff was all very helpful and solicitious....You exit the hotel, and behind you, up the street is the Pantheon, and Notre Dame is an eight minute walk in the opposite direction. We didn't realize how convenient the location was for sightseeing, the metro, and restaurants until we continued our stay in Paris for another 5 nights in the Champs Elysees/Arc de Triomphe area...we stayed in a 4-star hotel, paid over $100 per night more, and wanted to return to the St. Jacques.

Reviews.Title: “Fan-bloody-tastic!”
Reviews.Author: Londontraveller032
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to this hotel for a surprise birthday treat and they were brilliant. Very communicative by email in the weeks before the trip advising on their services etc. When we got to the hotel we had a fantastic room with views if the Pantheon and Notre Dame and a bottle of champagne and a card for my boyfriend! The hotel really did make our stay, all the staff were very polite and helpful, and though a little on the dear side, definately worth it. Plus aesthetically speaking, the place was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel St. Jacques”
Reviews.Author: Pearl099
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit to Hotel St. Jaques.  We found the hotel to be very charming and the staff most friendly.  We also loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “I love Paris in the Winter”
Reviews.Author: FantastiCally
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in excellent location - walking distance to Notre Dame and the Pantheon. I choose this hotel as my mum had never been to Paris and I wanted a place that really felt parisiean. This place didn't disappoint. There were busts in the lobby and in the room. Great decor and friendly staff. Free internet (we didnt find out until we left but you just have to ask the staff for the laptop and use it in the lobby). We didnt try the breakfast but they have a secure luggague store room and city maps (the quality of the maps was not great but that is not the hotels fault as it is the same tourist map you get everywhere). There is an excellent restaurant next door on the corner. Most important of all mum had a great time. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: J1PA
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Jacques is a cute little hotel located near the Pantheon building, or the University area. The hotel is a short walk to the underground metro system. You can also walk to most tourist sites from the hotel. It is actually quite enjoyable to walk around in Paris rather than take the subway, so this location is excellent for that. The hotel itself is probably a 1 or 2 star hotel in Paris; the rooms are small, showers small, but everything is relatively clean, affordable and accommodating in general. If you are an overweight American, I would avoid this hotel, rather most hotels in Paris that are 1 or 2 stars - you won't fit into the bathrooms! The staff gave us a smoking room which was lovely besides the stench, so we were given the choice of 3 other rooms to choose from at no additional costs! Very nice lady working at the reception desk! BOTTOM LINE: If you are on a budget, want a great location and decent stay, this is a good pick! If they are full, I highly recommend New Orient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: AMW84
Reviews.Content: Really great location, beautiful rooms. Worth the extra money to get a deluxe room with view of notre dame and the pantheon. Room was very spacious and wonderfully decorated. The staff was sweet and the 10 Euro breakfast was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: PSU79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel three times and will certainly go back the next time I am in Paris. I prefer the Latin Quarter area where the hotel is located - it is two blocks down from the Pantheon. The rooms are a nice size and the bathrooms have all been renovated. The staff is friendly and very helpful before the trip and while we were staying there. There are many great restuarants and cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, terrible room, horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: elldee75
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 nights after reading glowing reviews here. My experience was very, very different. Upon arrival, I staggered in with my bags late in the evening. It was clear I was beyond exhausted. The rude, rude man at the desk told me the lift was broken but should be fixed in an hour. I of course, would not expect conceirge service at a 2-star hotel in Paris, but none of the staff standing around lifted a finger to help me haul my bags up 4 flights of stairs, as I could not stand in the lobby for an hour waiting for the lift, as I was nearly ready to pass out from exhaustion. My room was a joke. I was told I would have a full bath on my email confirmation, but got a shower instead, and was too tired to argue. The "room" consisted of a tiny, (6x4 foot - I'm not kidding) lower level and an up-to-date renovated shower room (about 3x5), but the bed was in a loft area, up another 14 stairs. There was a chair jammed in the lower level, but no real room to even sit down for a minute, except for the bed up the stairs. If two people were sharing this room, one would have to stay upstairs while you are on the lower level. There is no way two people could occupy or dress on the lower level. This was during down season and most of the hotel was empty. I was given a room facing the alley, which provided a lovely view of rats scurrying about and vagrants using the alley as a toilet. I ended up storing my clothes on the stairway, which was a bit dangerous when trying to get down the narrow 14 stairs to use the bathroom at night. I was given no introduction to Paris, or a map or directions to the metro. Every other hotel I stayed at in Paris, from 2-4 stars provide at least some welcome and orientation. The deskman yelled at me (I'm not kidding) for not turning in my key before heading out for the day. I did not know that is what they wanted, as no one explained it and none of the other hotels I had booked in Paris expected this. I very politely explained this to him and said I was sorry (he speaks fluent English) and he treated me like I was a total idiot. The chamber maids did a very poor job cleaning my room. Toilet paper was not replaced, neither was soap or shampoo and yes, I did leave a tip out every morning, which they took. I was provided with two towels, and that's it. Carpet was not vacuumed once in 3 days. When I arrived the two micro glasses in the shower area were dirty with a previous guests toothpaste. The next day, these glasses were still not changed. I took them down to the rude owner and asked if I could have clean glasses, as these were still dirty from the previous occupant. He said he "didn't have any other ones". Finally, and very grudgingly, he got me two glasses from the bar and acted like I was the world's biggest aggravation. These glasses were never changed either and I finally bought some dish soap and washed them myself. The elevator worked once during the three days I was there. They claim room service is available for breakfast, but only if you order the petit dejeurner, which consists or a rock hard chunk of baguette, a decent croissant coffee, juice and fruit salad for 15 euro, which is about $28 Canadian. I ordered coffee the first morning and it did not arrive after 45 mintues. I phone the angry front desk man and asked if my coffee was coming or should I just head to a cafe. He rudely said "the girl must have forgotten" like it was my fault. No apology provided. When the "girl" arrived, even she didn't know where we could find space to set down the coffee tray. I finally took my suitcase upstairs and put it on the bed and we used the luggage rack for the coffee tray. One morning I tried the breakfast room. The young lady working there did not speak English. I heard her go upstairs and ask what I meant by omlette (which they have on the menu in English and French and which I pointed to and then mimed) and heard the rude man screaming at her for 15 minutes about my breakfast. Very pleasant for me to sit through. My French is good enough to know he was being abusive to her. After waiting for coffee for 30 minutes and still no omlette, I was ready to go cook it myself. When it finally arrived, the girl looked ready to cry. I can only imagine what it must be like to work for such an angry boss or owner. Yes, the hotel has frescos and looks very charming and has been renovated, is located near the tourist area and the bathroom was new. But the treatment I received would have made a tent in a field seem more inviting. There are literally 100 other 2 star hotels in this district and I suggest you book one of them. I paid 110 Euros a night for this debacle. I truly recommend springing for the extra 60 Euros and moving up to a three star hotel, where in my experience you will be treated like an honoured guest. You don't want to walk for 8 hours at the museums and cringe when you think of having to head back to your hotel. I stayed at the Hotel Aramis, another 2 star hotel for only $98 euro a night, also in a central district, and was treated like a guest by all staff, so there are other options, I really suggest you look for them and avoid this place. I left as soon as possible for another hotel and enjoyed my stay elsewhere. I would not send my dog to the Hotel St. Jacques.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: addabaj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Saint Jacques for 4 nights in early December and we had an excellent time. Our room on the top most floor, although very small, was extremely comfortable and had good views (even the Sacre Coeur in the distance). Brigette was very helpful, including ensuring an extremely early check-in and booking an airport shuttle pick-up. The hotel is at a great location, and definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Frimeur
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with lots of charm, but rooms are small. Extremely comfortable beds. Nice views of street from some rooms. Extremely convenient for shopping, restaurants, touring. Very friendly staff. Some rooms near elevator are noisy. Price seemed right for area.

Reviews.Title: “Latin Quarter home base”
Reviews.Author: KZjet
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel located in the Latin-Quarter was a perfect home base for my two night stay in Paris. It was my first visit so I wanted a central location where I could see the usual sights, but also walk the back streets to feel the city. My room had a full bathroom in it but other arrangements are available. My room had a television with several international channels. The hotel serves a traditional French breakfast for 9 euro each morning, and dozens of cafes are within a ten minute walk. It was a very quiet location, except that there was some hotel maintenance starting at around 8am, but it was the winter months so at least they waited until after tourist season. St Jacques is walking distance for adults to Notre-Dame, the Louvre, Nord train station, Eiffel Tower, and any place in between, and is located at the intersection of major streets that show on most maps, so communicating directions to a cab driver or looking up a bus route on a map is easy. I will check this hotel first on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay at the St. Jacques!”
Reviews.Author: TexasGal67
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel from 11/20/08 to 11/28/08 and booked two rooms double superior rooms at a rate of 100 Euros per night. Both rooms were fantastic and we could not be more happy with the location and the quality of the hotel. I would highly recommend the St. Jacques to anyone going to Paris. It is ideally located in the 5th Arrondissement in the Latin Quarter, just down the street from the Pantheon and the Sorbonne. It is in walking distance to restaurants, shops, anything you need! I cannot imagine staying anywhere else in Paris! Room #5 had two windows that opened to a long balcony. The room has a separate bathroom & toilet room. The large king-size bed was very comfortable. The bureau was large enough for two people to store their belongings and it had an in-room safe. It had a large plasma tv on the wall and two small nightstands with lamps next to the bed. The room was spotless and the decor and ambience only added to the overall trip. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and very friendly. They helped us to arrange shuttle service to/from CDG airport for $17 per person one-way. Room #7 was beautiful as well. It had a couch and small table and the bathroom was beautiful. It too, was facing the street and had a balcony. We thoroughly enjoyed our first trip to Paris and staying at the Hotel St. Jacques only added to the wonderful overall experience. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RonelR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the St Jacques for four nights at the beginning of October, and I will definitely stay there again. My single room (No. 40 at 92 euros per night) was, if not spacious, then certainly big enough for a single person, and I had enough cupboard space for the duration of my stay. My window looked out on the little side street next to the hotel (the same little side street that leads up to the Pantheon, which is so worth a visit) and the room was thus quiet at night. The staff were really tolerant when we had a bit of a session in the downstairs bar, although I thought it was a bit unnecessary that they did not allow an ice bucket in one's room. They want you to buy their bubbly instead. The male receptionist had no problem giving us an ice bucket, but Brigitte balked. Back to the room, which was clean and serviced every day. There was a nasty cigarette burn in the bedcover, though. Surely it will make a better impression if this cover is replaced? Bathroom was small, but it was a single room after all! My friend's twin room down the passage was large and overlooked Rue des Ecoles. The hotel is easy to get to from CdG airport. I arrived on a quiet Sunday morning, and simply bought a ticket to St Michel station, and 40 minutes later had arrived. I followed the signs to Place St Michel, walked up Blvd St Michel and turned left into Rue des Ecoles. Could not be simpler with one small backpack and one wheelie-bag. The area was great, with lots of shops, cafes and restaurants (try Naf-Naf in Blvd St Michel for great, reasonable fashion). I am already planning my next trip to Paris, and I would love to stay at the St Jacques again.

Reviews.Title: “Super St Jacques”
Reviews.Author: harblinger
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous looking property in a great location a stone's throw from the Pantheon. You can easily find the hotel as it is about 2 mins walk from Maubert Mutualite Metro or 5-7 minutes from Luxembourg RER. Turned up early and allowed to check in early. Lady on reception was bubbly and friendly and made us feel very welcome. Had booked a larger room and loved the fresco's on the wall and ceiling, bed was comfy and the pillows lovely and soft. The decor is looking a little faded but this really adds to the charm and ambience of this place so it's of no detriment to the hotel in any way. There are loads of bars and restaurants in the area which are not as extortionate as other parts of Paris (being near the Sorbonne makes it a studenty area so prices reflect that). The only downside is that our room was facing the main street so at night part-pickled students singing or scooters going past the hotel was a bit disturbing when we wanted an early night i.e. before midnight Had a great 3 days here and will be booking to stay again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful St Jacques”
Reviews.Author: lozzam
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at St Jacques & loved every minute we were there, the staff were more than helpful, Bridgett we thank you for all your efforts with directions ETC just perfect customer relations. The atmosphere of this Hotel & the overall ambience is very rewarding for the patrons, the breakfast Lady was brilliant to say the least nothing was too much trouble for Her again as with Bridgett thank You The setting in the front room for pre dinner drinks was perfect, and again the staff who served us were more than helpful & friendly. The rooms were beautiful the murals on the walls & ceilings very relaxing I know the Manager of St Jacques monitors these reviews as I have read a reply he sent back recently well to the Manager your Hotel & Your Staff do You proud and we do not hesitate to put St Jacques name up to people looking to stay in Beautiful Paris as they could only be satisfied with their visit as we well & truly were and we will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel St. Jacques”
Reviews.Author: Jannou
Reviews.Content: I have just returned after spending two weeks at this wonderful hotel. The rooms are a good size by Paris standards and my room No 16 was very clean and decorated with beautiful murals both on the walls and ceilings. The Foyer is so cute and so French. The Breakfast room, where they served delicious treats was delightful. The Staff especially Brigitt, were so helpful, nothing was too much trouble. This special little place in Paris is in a very good location, only a couple of minutes from Notre Dame, the Pantheon and the Sorbonne. It's an easy walk to Boulevarde St. Germain where you will find famous cafes such as Les Deux Magots , Cafe Flore and Brasserie Lipp. I refer to the Hotel St. Jacques as my home in Paris because of the warmth and ambience that you get once you step inside. I travelled alone and was made to feel both safe and secure. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants the French Experience. To all the Staff, thank you so much, it was a pleasure and I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBarney
Reviews.Content: If your criteria includes: - excellent value for money - central, safe and quiet location - French style rooms with antique style furniture and balcony Then this hotel will suit! The rooms here range in price according to quality of furnishings and size. We just took the standard triple room but was nevertheless impressed with its French style decor. There was also a fireplace (not working) and lovely plastering on the ceiling. There are balconies with each room and also paintings on the wall. Although our room overlooked the main street it was very quiet as the windows were double glazed. They also had a fan which was very useful as we were there in the summer. We found the beds to be comfortable, but I think they are shorter in length than standard size. I would imagine anyone over 6ft would have their feet hanging off the end. We had the summer time promotion which included breakfast when booked directly through the hotel website. This was basic continental but was good value considering the rate. The only down point was that we had to ask and remind them of this rather than it being offered. Location was great. Many nice restaurants/cafes around. It is 2mins walk to the nearest metro. The river and Notre Dame are 5mins walk away and St Germain shopping just down the road. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: readytogo60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Saint Jacques for a total of 5 nights this July. The hotel is magnificently located in the Latin Quarter. We found our room to be very charming, with a modern convenient bathroom. The rooms are quite roomy by Paris standards. Our room faced the road and there was quite a lot of traffic noise when the windows were open. However, at night we had a fan to keep things cool and when we closed the windows the room was very sound proof. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel, as it is a great blend of convenience and authentic European charm!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rosebay
Reviews.Content: We were warned that generally the hotel rooms in Paris are small and prepared ourselves to fold in half, however, we were pleasantly surprised with Hotel St Jacques, our room was a very good size and immaculately clean. Joe and Hotel staff were friendly and helpful and even booked a popular restaurant for us. The location is brilliant and we could not have been more pleased with our stay at Hotel St Jacques.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bassist
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel in Latin Quarter. Good location. Helpfull staff. Beautiful room. What you'd expect Paris to be!

Reviews.Title: “I love Paris and the Hotel St Jaques”
Reviews.Author: missingca4
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a great week. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Our room was small but perfect for the two of us. Our balcony was so cute. I loved sitting at the window and watching the people on the street below. I cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “not again”
Reviews.Author: jjanvil
Reviews.Content: We would not stay there again. The staff was not pleasant. We originally made our reservations through Bridgette, who was excellent, but unfortunately she was hardly there when we were staying at the hotel. Also the room was too tiny for us. I requested a larger room but was very disappointed that we didn't get it, especially since we made this request over 6 months in advance. The one good thing was the location. We love the area which we revisit every time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GenevieveRI
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel St. Jacques for a week in early May. It was our first time in Paris and we were celebrating our 25th anniversary. I spent a lot of time researching hotels, hotel locations, room size and prices, etc before settling on Hotel St. Jacques and we were very pleased with our choice. We had room #16 and although, I have to admit, it was smaller than I was expecting (we did not have a balcony or a view of Pantheon/Notre Dame as some rooms seem to), it was very clean and we loved the murals on the walls and Queen size bed. The bathroom was a good size, very updated, with good water pressure. My only complaint in this area is the hair dryer cannot be used very long before your hand gets too hot holding it. Wish I had brought my own. We kept the portable fan on at night so outside noise was never a problem even though our room was above Rue des Ecoles. I noticed several reviews mentioning the remodelling noise. We did see the remodelling going on when we were there but were never woken up by it - any noise (and it was minimal near our room) seemed to start after our wake-up call. There was evidence of the remodelling in the hallways but it didn't bother us. I do agree with the other reviewers, however, that maybe it would be appropriate for them to make mention of the remodelling when reservations are made (or maybe give an incentive like a discounted or free breakfast during the remodelling stage). I think I read on their website that they are adding air conditioning so I think it is a positive feature of the hotel that they are remodelling the rooms and adding a/c. We were especially impressed with the staff and found that all of them were extremely helpful, courteous and friendly to us. The hotel offers breakfast but we passed as we preferred to grab a croissant on the go. My husband did, however, order coffee there a few mornings and found he enjoyed this as the little individual pot of coffee provided him with about 2 cups for the price he paid for one "to go" cup from places we passed while walking. I thnk one of the best features of Hotel St. Jacques is its location - in the Latin Quarter, 1.5 blocks from Metro Maubert Mutualite, and a 5 minute walk to Notre Dame, St. Michel (RER and metro), etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend and stay here again if we ever get the chance to return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel if not for the renovation”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaRes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at an excellent location, short walk from a couple of metro stops, and a hop/skip from the Latin Quarters, down to Notre Dame, the Louvre, etc. Street noise isn't too bad of a problem, it is not a very congested street. There are a few restaurants close by, though none are great restaurants. The hotel has the old-world charm, very "french" with nice paintings and furniture everywhere. Our room is tiny, and the bathroom is so small that you hardly have room to stand in there with the door open. However, this is Paris, so one doesn't expect a great luxurious room at the rate that St Jacques charges. However, there is one problem that made me unhappy, and thus I am not giving them a high rating. There was extensive renovation going on while we were there (our light was taped up for a day because it needed to be re-plastered back). Walls were being torn down outside our room, there was drop-cloths everywhere in the hallway, dust everywhere, doors and other building materials lying around in the hallway, stairs, etc. Workers used our key (which we left with the receptionist) and came into our room to do work while we were not there, and left dirty towels on the floor next to our bed. I agree with the previous reviewer that the hotel should have had a warning about this renovation on the site, or in the hotel confirmation, and then should have offered a reduction in rate. This was not the case. The breakfast was ok, but not really worth 10 euros. You can walk across the street and get a freshly cooked omlette and coffee for less. I probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kajon
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 fabulous nights at the Hotel St. Jacques. We had room #26 which was a double deluxe corner room. It was wonderful! It was newly decorated, huge and with a very comfortable king sized bed and a new bathroom. We are shower people, and even though this room only comes with a bath (huge tub with sprayer), we would book this room again. There were some men doing electrical work in the hallways, but they were very polite. When the windows were shut there was no street noise. We slept with the windows open and yes we could hear street noise, but the only time it disrupted our sleep was the night of a big football game when we could hear the people in the bars cheering. There are two cafe/bar/restaurants across the street, the metro is 1 1/2 blocks away and my morning croissants were only a block down the street. We found the hotel staff friendly and the only problem we had is that our wake up call did not come.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good this time”
Reviews.Author: Deptford-bill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at St. Jacques on many occasions since 2003. After having a poor stay there in August 07 we had toyed with the idea of finding another hotel in the Latin quarter but thought we'd give St. Jacques one last chance. Sadly, this time round , it was worse than before. We encountered extensive building works within the hotel and indifferent staff. Our stay included power cuts, water loss, dust and noise - each of which was caused/attributed to the work. I suggested to the hotel manager that it would've been a point of courtesy to advise guests of the works when booking - this was met with a shrug. I was left feeling that St. Jacques is trading more so on it's location rather than it's once excellent reputation as a hotel. For people looking for a great location and a now 'okay hotel' - this is the one. Everything changes, for the better and for the worse. For this long time guest, it is definately time for a change.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JurimoToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Spent four days here. The location was great. Easy walk to main sites and right around the corner from Notre Dame. Large number of restaurants and cafes just steps away. Very friendly and helpful staff. Two concerns. Our room, #29, was very small. It had a double bed which took up most of the space. There was nowhere to put our suitcases and so we were constantly having to step over them. We couldn't put them away because there was no place to unpack our clothes. As well, it was quite warm so we wanted to leave the window open but the street was very noisy, even though we were on the top floor. I would readily stay there again but would have to be assured of a larger room on the side away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Toute Suite!”
Reviews.Author: Holidz
Reviews.Content: Loved the "D'une Ambiance", aka: "old Paris charm", different in each room . Geat location:Could walk all over 5th & 6th Arrr, anytime of day or night, and I do mean any time, when the cafes and winding streets comes alive at 11:00PM, and are going strong at 3:00AM. ! Our cornor room, #19, was perfect for this girlfriends birthday celebration trip: laughs, food, sites & shopping. We had 3 beds, two opening windows, view uphill to Patheon, and downhill to Notre Dame; 2 blks to St Germain & St Michael; easy to get Metro, though, we preferred walking along the Le Seine; or the BatoBus. The staff was wonderful, esp Bridgette, helpful, smiling, efficient, and got our room arranged out for an early check-in; and Joe, accomodating my "morning" request for "double caffe" at 1:00PM , (even when the kitchen closes at 11:AM.) and booking reliable tours & shuttles. . There was some repair work going on in the hallways which you need to over look for the 137 euro price (estm $200); It did not prevent me from sleeping to noon. The elevator only goes to 5th floor, (of this 6 floor bldg)... had to laugh when my 100# girl friend, couldn't squeeze in with her two 50# bags! Made two trips instead.... and we admired the inlaid wood panneling, instead of gripping...C'est la Vie! . Next trip will be annivsary with my husband, and we'll be back! We'll ask for #22, large room, painted ceiling,Q bed, and sitting area, full bath; or #25 with wrap around balcony. All rooms had windows with sheers, plus heavy drapes, and double pained windows for sound. I think this hotel is suitable for all types of travellers and occasions. Good value for the current USA dollar woes. Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Muniz
Reviews.Content: Every time we return to Paris, we search for a room in Saint Jacques. It's a lovely place, full of charm, well located (try the restaurant Perigordine, next corner) and the staff is cordial and try to make you feel welcome. It's because of them that we always return to this hotel. Rooms are diferent from each other and decorated with good taste. Bathroom is small, but clean. Breakfast is not included in the price. If you plan to stay here, you must book it ahead, because it's always full. I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and quaint!”
Reviews.Author: Mrfozzy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our second trip to Paris, last year we stayed in a 3 star (It was our 25th wedding anniversary) so this time we opted for something a little cheaper. The reviews on tripadvisor seemed good so we gave it a try and we were glad we did. This hotel is a real home from home, the hotel itself is beautifully decorated with murals and frescos in almost every nook and cranny. Our room was (Room 25) on the 5th floor and was larger than we expected it to be, very clean and very comfortable with a bathroom that had a good hot shower, also it had a small balcony that had lovely views of the Pantheon in one direction and the Notre Dame in the other. Breakfast was served in an elegant room in the basement, again decorated in frescos, the breakfast itself was plentiful and served by friendly and efficient staff. This hotel is in an excellent location,surrounded by the many restaurants and bars in the Latin Quarter, close to the Pantheon and Luxembourg Gardens and only 10 minutes to the Notre Dame, a great base from which to explore this lovely city. We found the staff to be very pleasant and it is obvious a lot of hard work has been put in to this hotel, we thoroughly enjoyed it and will definitely be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: frohicke63
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from paris and will remember this trip for the rest of our lives. The Hotel St Jacques is a little bit of heaven that sits in the Latin quarter. It is surrounded by wonderful, quaint streets littered with cafes and bistros. We ate at le coupe chou and le petit prince which are both around the corner. But enough about that. The hotel!! Upon arrival we were warmly greeted by the staff and given a room on the 5th floor. We had a wraparound balcony that gave us a view of the Pantheon and Notre Dame. Breathtaking! The room was not overly large but really comfortable and there was a towel warmer!! In the afternoon we were able to get a bottle of wine from the bar downstairs which served as pre-dinner drinks in our room. Nothing like a glass of wine while you stare at Nore Dame :) Our treatment could not have been better and we are quite seasoned travellers and have stayed in some of the finer establishments in large cities around the world and this simply ranks up there with the best of them. We heartily recommend Hotel St Jacques for your next trip to Paris Dave and Tracy Hennessy Danbury, CT

Reviews.Title: “room 11”
Reviews.Author: monkeysboy
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Friday and were unable to obtain a superior room on check-in and were assigned a standard room, #11 on the 3rd floor. The room was large enough but badly in need of a thorough cleaning and renovation. There was no bedspread on the bed, only an unattractive brown blanket. On our last night in Paris we returned to the hotel to find that the toilet seat had been removed and we were left with a porcelain rim on which to sit. We were told that the cleaning staff found that it was cracked and posed a threat to us. Since this was a Sunday there was no recourse to remedy the situation. We felt duct tape might have been used to make temporary repairs. We first met Brigette on the Monday of our last day who patiently listened to our woes. She was most gracious about the problems, had the room service staff show us the toilet seat which was removed, and adjusted our bill.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Value Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbradyesq
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris several times and staying at 2, 3 and 4 star hotels, and having been to major capitals in Europe on several other occasions, I've developed a fairly good sense of the star ratings employed in each country. My personal preference is for older, "belle epoque" era hotels in France, as chrome and glass does little for my sensibilities when travelling in Europe. The St Jacques fit the description well. It is much underrated as a Parisian 2 star, properly deserving at least a 3 and perhaps even a 3+. It is not new, does not need to be, and carries its age with grace and dignity befitting its location and style. The St Jacques was well situated for my presentation at an environmental law conference just down the street at the Sorbonne, which was why I initialy chose it. The online reviews were fairly consistent and complimentary, so I took a chance. I was not disappointed. A quaint and charming hotel run by a superbly knowledgable and helpful staff, I enjoyed every moment of my 6 day stay. Little details like recommending taking an umbrella from the hotel stand due to an unfriendly weather forecast, or recommending good restaurants appropriately suited to my mood and requests, both close by as well as in other arrondissements, directing me to the various Metro lines, exchanges, shopping, restaurants, etc, and locating phone numbers in the directory, not to mention fielding phone calls from Air France tracking my lost luggage for two days, all while patiently putting up with my badly fractured French and gently assisting with pronunciation and vocabulary, are simply a few examples of the kind and gracious hospitality that Joe, Brigitte, Alexski and a few others extended. Even the housecleaning staff was smiling, friendly and warm. Breakfast in the hotel's antique-filled Toulouse-Lautrec dining room was no less well prepared and served than that at Cafe AuxTours de Notre Dame where I stopped one morning. Ask for my room, number 10, a superior double room displayed on the hotel website replete with a fresco wall mural and plasma TV. I recommend this hotel for those who have an image of a small, friendly hotel in the Latin Quarter. You won't forget it. I am hopefully planning a return trip to the St Jacques with my family of 4 later this year if we can finalize schedules before the larger rooms are booked. As for value, my room was less than the price of a 3 star hotel where we stayed two years ago in Montmartre, And twice as nice.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable hotel with good staff but probably not a place we'd return to”
Reviews.Author: Skizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel St Jacques for 2 nights in room 14 on the 3rd floor. This was a superior room booked directly with the hotel. There are 3 grades of room (standard, superior and deluxe). The standard rooms are small (I peered into a room which was being redecorated), our superior room in the corner of the building was large with 2 windows; we didn’t get to see the deluxe rooms. Leaning out of our window we could see both the Pantheon and Notre Dame. The links with the Audrey Hepburn movie Charade made an interesting talking point with friends/colleagues. The hotel staff were fairly helpful. I think I met the grumpy receptionist mentioned by the previous reviewer but he wasn’t that bad - for example, he was gruff but arranged for me to check in early and he really put himself out to help with a dodgy remote control (which turned to be my fault). We had an issue about the receipt as did the last reviewer, but the receptionist who was working on that day was in fact very helpful indeed when we explained what we needed. Overall, the hotel does everything within its control to provide a good experience. We liked the complementary umbrellas available at reception (v rainy when we were there) and the boiled sweets. There’s a laptop in the reception for internet access (you have to ask for the computer) and there’s wireless internet access in reception and on the second floor. However, the issue for us was noise. Rue des Ecoles is busy day and night. Outside the hotel is a set of traffic lights, so there is traffic accelerating and decelerating outside the window (which are double glazed but didn’t block out noise sufficiently). Noisy motorcycles buzz by with annoying frequency. People singing and shouting in the street were perhaps not expected at 3am… (they weren’t British!). Most of the rooms look over the main road – apparently only the deluxe rooms face away from the road (so we were told by Mr Grumpy). I don’t know how much quieter the rooms at the back were – the alley out the back seemed quite noisy. I guess it depends on your tolerance of noise. A few other hotels in the Latin quarter are situated down side streets (and are quieter as a result). Interestingly, we couldn’t hear noise from the other rooms – many old buildings converted into hotels have flimsy walls. This place was an exception – noise insulation from other rooms was good, although guests chatting in the corridor outside our room on their return at night seemed very loud and woke us up. The location of the hotel was good – only a medium/short walk to other attractions. By the way, don’t confuse this hotel with the similarly named Hotel Relais St Jacques (also in the Latin quarter). We didn’t pay for breakfast in the hotel - there were street markets and a boulangerie nearby which were fine for breakfast. Our non-hotel top tips were the next door Manga café next door (wireless internet access with unlimited non-alcoholic drinks, comfy sofas etc) and restaurants around the Pantheon. On balance, price-wise this place was good value, with a reasonable location. The staff were good. However, we wouldn’t stay there again because of the noise. Garry & Katja

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price for a perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: ustrauss
Reviews.Content: This was the sweetest little hotel. The people at the desk were always helpful and spoke good English. The breakfast was simple and cheap and hit the spot for a quick meal. The room was really clean and so was the bathroom. I really have no complaints about this. The hotel room reminded me of a more expensive hotel I stayed in in NYC. Small, no room for yoga (who cares?) and everything you need. Cute decor, not tacky just tasteful. I would stay here in a heartbeat if I ever go to Paris again. Just remember: Check-in is around 12pm there, so if you have an early flight, don't plan on checking in in the early morning. That was my only complaint is that they said it would be ready by 11 but it was ready at 12...a very small complaint! Totally happy with everything I got from this hotel. They are also great for wakeup calls. The room that I stayed in did not have an alarm clock so make sure to bring a clock. Also bring shampoo and conditioner because they don't give it to you, I did not mind that custom at all. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: smithjnf
Reviews.Content: My 15 year old daughter and I stayed in Room #4, very spacious, with a roomy, modern bath. I paid to have breakfast each morning, baskets of fresh bread, pain au chocolat, pastries. The coffee was excellent and super hot, my daughter loved the hot chocolate. We walked to the batobus (water taxi) station near Notre Dame everyday. Location is excellent, Brigitte, front desk, was lovely as was the rest of the hotel staff we ran into. They were in the middle of renovating some of the rooms, but we weren't disturbed at all by noise. It is the student section, so the outside noise level was higher during the weekend nights. For what we needed, a clean, convenient place to stay, this hotel exceeded our expectations. Definitely would use again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for a romantic w/end in paris”
Reviews.Author: hoopsLongford
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights in Dec 07. Hotel is very quaint and perfectly located. 2 min walk to the metro. Lots of cafes and resturants in the vicinity of the hotel. Less than 10 min walk to Notre Dame. Perfect hotel for romantic w/end in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SaintJohnNorthampton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated, within easy walking distance of the Notre Dame & metro stations & with plenty of local restaurants. Our party of 3 couples booked superior doubles for 3 nights at 137 euros per room per night and were delighted when we were offered breakfast also within the price. Before arriving, we were slightly nervous that, despite the mainly positive reviews, we had booked a 2 star hotel but were pleasantly surprised and we would echo the positive comments of previous reviewers with regard to the hotel accommodation & staff attitude & helpfulness. We pre-booked the airport shuttle via the concierge which cost 17 euros per person each way including luggage to Charles de Gaulle

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: Katstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel St Jacques for one night and thought it was a lovely little place to stay. I had the superior double room which had a King (or King Queen) bed, nice paintwork, clean bathroom and nice little balcony overlooking the street on the 5th floor. Only 5 min (if that) walk to the RER and Metro stations and a short stroll to St Germain Blvd. Breakfast room is sweet with nice paintwork. I got a free continental breakfast with the 'winter special' deal and it was very nice. If I could find anything wrong, there is a very tiny lift and if you were travelling with more than one person with luggage you'll have to take a couple of trips in the lift. Otherwise I just went down the stairs and the lights came on automatically so you weren't left in the dark. The location of this place is 5 min stroll from Diptyque shop for the lovers of find candles etc out there :)

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: bluesfamily
Reviews.Content: We had decided to pay a bit more than we usually would for a Paris hotel so chose the St Jacques based on reviews. It wasn't worth it. It struck us a pretty low standard hotel with a few tassles and bits of 'fancy' paintwork but really offered nothing more than cheaper places. We had a triple room which was cramped for three of us, even by Paris standards, and uncomfortably over-heated. The shower was laughably small and rather stinky. The front desk staff were grim-faced and not especially helpful. We're used to the Parisian manner but these guys seemed distinctly miserable. Access to the internet was absurdly expensive (6 euros for 30 minutes) and awkward - you had to perch on a stool in the foyer with a laptop balanced on knees. Maybe this place struck us as disappointing because we'd come from Spain where the hotels were so much better - stylish immaculate rooms, friendly staff, great internet service, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl17
Reviews.Content: We (two other friends and I) stayed one night at the Hotel St. Jacques and found it to be a very pleasant and well located hotel! I loved the area around this hotel. The front staff (Joe and Phillip) were wonderful and answered any and all questions! We had the triple room on the first floor, and while it was a bit noisy, it didn't bother us a bit as we had walked ourselves silly and slept like babies! I was pleasantly suprised at the size of the room and the bathroom, and it was very clean. We had a great stay and would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great value in a great neighborhood!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay for a couple in paris”
Reviews.Author: susjeda
Reviews.Content: First of all, that wasn't my first stay in Paris - I was there a year ago for 2 months. But, now I decided to spend a romantic weekend with my boyfriend. We stayed there fri-sat-sun. I booked this hotel 3 months in advance, based on reviews from tripadvisor - AND- I wasn't wrong! First of all I have to mention that the price was a bargain - winter promotion including breakfast - just 90 euros per night for 2 people for double room. I was suspicious so I called the reception to ask about the bed size (since my boyfriend is 190cm -maybe the price was low because it was a single bed or something). But I kind receptionist explained that the room was smaller than others, but the size of bed is normal (double). When we arrived - the room was perfectly CLEAN, we had even a hair-drier in the bathroom plus we got the best view - Notre Dame on our right and Pantheon on our left (from our small french balcony). I was lucky! The room was on the 5th floor (so you have to climb one more floor because the last stop for the elevator is 4th floor). The elevator is not for people who weight too much because it is rather small! So be aware of that. The best thing is that you have a free safe in the room so we left our passports there. But the very best thing was the breakfast (mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm) and the people who were working there and were very very kind (all of them!). Did I forget to mention that the hotel was near the river Seine? 5 minutes on foot till the Notre Dame? Ouuu yeah. It is also easy to get there from the airport (use RER B till Saint Michel and then use your feet for couple of minutes or go by metro 1¸minute). Anyway, I will come again for sure! Even if I get the chance to stay in better hotels for bussiness meetings because it is A+ hotel (although I was suspicious because I read 2 reviews that weren't really nice here - but as far as I am concerned - it was PERFECT ROMANTIC STAY IN PARIS). I would not recomend it maybe to very old people because the bathroom is small, but hey - you can get a deluxe room :D I wanted to spend the money on shopping in galerie laffayete and in the restaurants and the double room was perfect for me/us. Greetings from Zagreb, Croatia!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St. Jacques is superb!”
Reviews.Author: williamLandry
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Hotel St Jacques in Paris for about a month at a time, two or three times a year. Since I go often to Paris these last eight years, I have tried many hotels, but this one is absolutely the best so I stay there now whenever I am in Paris. The St Jacques is an outstanding hotel, small and friendly, the staff extremely helpful, the beds are comfortable, the rooms are fine and well kept up and yet it is relatively inexpensive. The location is perfect, in the wonderful 5th arrondissement between Notre Dame and the Pantheon. It is one block from a metro stop and there are three bus lines on the street (rue des Ecoles) on which the hotel is located. The St Jacques is just a few blocks from bd. St Michael where there are at least four other bus lines so that you can get readily to any part of Paris by public transportation. Being near the center of the university section there are many small and large book stores, and small and large movie theaters to say nothing of wonderful restaurants and cafes an outdoor market, and one of the best bakeries in Paris. I recommend this hotel extremely highly.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: bubbafranks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the heart of the Latin Quarter and St. Germain. We were in Paris during the recent strike and therefore walked everywhere. We were thankful we chose to stay in this hotel because of the location. Our room was on the top floor--very small room. The room was nothing special but did have a tiny balcony that was nice. The walls are thin and the noise can keep you up. However, the front desk were so kind and helpful (even giving us umbrellas at night when it was raining).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - Room #25 is great”
Reviews.Author: treehugger99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room #25. The views from the wraparound balcony were breathtaking - you could see Notre Dame and the Pantheon. This particular room was very romantic, we loved the decoration. The only thing that was a bit unpleasant was that the water in the shower would sometimes alternate between hot and cold. But it was very clean. I would recommend skipping the breakfast. You can find better food for the price at the cafe across the street (walk across the street, and turn left. Its the first cafe you bump into. ) Other than that, we had no problems at all at this hotel. After checkout, we were able to store our luggage in the lobby closet, which was very helpful. One note I would like to add for people who have never been to Paris - I have read many American reviews of Paris hotels, and there seems to be an ongoing trend that I think might be giving future tourists a bad impression. I think that most Americans are used to having their butts kissed at most hotels they stay at in the States. The service industry at home is completely different than it is in Europe, particularly France. The people of Paris, are actually some of the kindest and most polite people I have come across. Their attitude is different, as their culture is different. They are doing you a service, and the way they see it, there is no reason they should have to take any crap from customers. They don't smile a whole lot, and they always seems to be in a hurry. Its just the nature of the city. But they say PLEASE and THANK YOU, and expect you to do the same. If you give them any kind of grief in a rude manner, they will likely not respond well. (At one hotel I stayed at, I saw an American man yelling at the front desk attendant, and after she tried to solve the problem, albeit not to his liking, she just walked away as he continued to yell.) In the States, if you yell, someone will likely help you faster. But here, if you are rude, they will walk away. And I say God Bless it. I love them for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: motwigg
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights there in early November. The location was excellent - very close to Notre Dam and other fun areas. There was a great bar called the Rubarb just up the street that was very friendly. The walls are a bit thin but that was expected as was some of the noise on Saturday night. If you are barve enough to drive there parking can be somewhat of an issue as we had to find a public parking area nearby. The staff was very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “No faults to mention.”
Reviews.Author: chris1107
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and my fourth trip to Europe in the past three years. At this point, I now know what to expect of a 3 star hotel in Europe and this hotel was the best of them all. Perhaps because my single room was tucked away at the end of the first floor, it was quite peaceful at night. I would also advise skipping the additional fee for breakfast. I never had breakfast (petite dejeuner) in the hotel, but as I become a more experienced traveler - I realize that every moment that can be experienced outside the hotel is far more enjoyable and often less expensive. The neighborhood is not as busy as some other parts of the Latin Quater (at least not in November) adding to my favorable experience. And I should note that my room was on the street level at the back of the hotel. Transportation is easily accessible and there are plenty of places to get a meal nearby, I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again upon returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tayl9512
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews of this hotel we were really looking forward to a unique experience in the Latin Quarter. We had requested a special room because it was an anniversary trip for us and had received email that they "would do what we can". When we arrived, we were greeted by a polite but not really friendly receptionist who handed us a key to our room and pointed ot the lift. The room itself must have been nice once, but not anymore. The carpeting was old and mildewed, the paint was in bad need of redoing and the view of the street was not what we had hoped for. The bathroom was small but modern enough, unfortunately, the shower leaked so badly, the carpet outside was rotted. The other problem was there were no free outlets in the room. In order to plug in chargers for cell phone or camera battery, we had to unplug one of the lamps and there were only two of them. The TV was the size of a box of kleenex. We had purchased a breakfast option, thinking it would be a timesaver. Unfortunately, the breakfasts were really sparse as well and served by one poor overworked woman who had long ago lost any passion for her work. The biggest problem though was service. We had requested recommendations for restaurants and were referred to what must be two of the worst restaurants in Paris. When we asked the concierge to book a restaurant from a guide book, she seemed irritated and said she had never heard of the place (even though it has been reviewed in multiple guide books.) Two days before we left, we inquired about reserving a van to the airport. We were told it could be done the day before, which we asked them to do. The night before our departure, we were told the van was "unavailable" and we would have to take a taxi. We found another van service which we reserved ourselves. On another occasion, we asked them to call a taxi and none showed up. When we tried to hail one ourselves, we were told that was "not allowed" even though we had waited a half an hour for the one they called. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel,even at the price. Much better to stay closer to the Seine, nearer the Rue de St Germaine or better yet in the Rue Cler district.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: cm510
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel after reading all the great reviews. From the moment we stepped into our room we were terribly disappointed. The room was extremely small and there was no place to put any clothes except for a small wardrobe which would only hold a few items. Unless you want to literally live out of a suitcase, this is not the place to be. When we pulled down the comforter, the sheets were seemingly clean, but covered with black stains. The hotel must pump some sort of perfume into the air handling system to cover up the smell of cigarette smoke and the combination of the two was nauseating. To try to get rid of the smell, we opened the windows, but the street noise of partying students was so loud and went so late into the night (3AM) that we had to close the windows (and yet could still hear the street noise) By about 6AM, the people in the room next to us started their day and the walls in this hotel are so paper thin that it sounded like they were in the room with us. We were supposed to stay 8 nights but checked out after two nights. The only positive things I can say is that the people were friendly , the bed was comfortable and it was close to the Metro, but after spending a week in Paris (which is the most beautiful city) you realize that you are never far from the Metro. I could not recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hotel St Jacques for a quick Paris getaway on August 31st and we were not disappointed! Getting to the hotel from CDG was very easy and convenient. We took the RER B to St Michel and walked about 7 minutes to the hotel. We were warmly welcomed by Joe and our room was ready and waiting for us! We stayed at a twin room on the 2nd floor with a very spacious bathroom (hairdryer and usual bathroom amenities included). It had a balcony facing Rue Des Carmes with a breathtaking view of the Pantheon on your left. We also had an in-room safe, cable TV and extra blankets for the cool Paris evenings. The Hotel St Jacques is in a wonderful location with lots of must see Paris sights within walking distance. There are quite a few choices of cafes, bistros and boulangeries around the area -lots of eats and treats. Plus there is a weekend market right by the Maubert Mutualite Metro Station (a 2 minutes walk) with tons of interesting food and merchandise! We caught a hop on-hop-off city tour bus (L'Open Tour) 5 minutes from the hotel with several routes to choose from (Notre Dame Stop or Petit Pont Stop). This is a central location for your Paris visit - very ideal, but it can get loud in the evenings with happy young people up and down the street very late at night. It may help to close the double paned windows to filter the street noise, but then again, we wanted the cool evening breeze. Hotel St Jacques is a reasonably priced hotel in a wonderful location and I would not hesitate to recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ziggeries
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Jacques was a terrific place to stay. It is in the heart of Paris just a few short blocks south of Notre Dame. The room we had was on the top floor, so we had a beautiful (but small) balcony overlooking the Rue Ecoles. If you stay in this room, you have to climb one set of stairs from the 5th floor to the 6th as the tiny elevator only goes to the 5th. They have a wonderful little cafe downstairs and we got breakfast included with our room. Some of the rooms appearantly don't have a bathroom in the room, but we got one with a bathroom. The room itself was kind of small, but hey, it's Paris! What are you gonna spend all day lounging around your room?!? The bed was nice and comfy, AND we paid a lot less than our friends that stayed a bit farther West (and got nicer service). We'll definately visit again. Merci Joe!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us”
Reviews.Author: Hattie1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Paris with our 10 year old daughter. We stayed at the Hotel St. Jacques for a week and would have happily stayed longer. We had a triple room on the corner of the building with a small balcony. The room was small with no dresser, but a small closet and cupboard to put a few things away. The room was beatifully painted (as is the whole hotel) with scenes from Paris. Our bathroom was small, but modern, clean and bright. We were close to everything: coffee, restaurants (Le Petit Prince 1 1/2 blocks away was a standout), Pantheon, Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame and the Seine, Metro stops... We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, so I can't comment on that aspect, but the room looked nice. We were lucky wth cool weather, but it was still nice to have the quiet fan that was in the room as it can get noisy in the Latin Quarter at night with cheerful young people heading home after a fun night out. We loved the keys on a huge fob that we would return to the desk as we went out for the day. My daughter loved the very small elevator, which I only used the first and last days to bring the luggage up and down. The only downside was that my husband had some trouble with the internet in the room (unfortunately, he had to work a few hours a day) and had to go to the lobby sitting room to use his computer. Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was pleasant and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute saviours”
Reviews.Author: Cleopus
Reviews.Content: We only confirmed dates for our trip to Paris a week before leaving so I emailed every budget hotel in Paris that was in the top 30 of Tripadvisor (we needed 2 bedrooms for us and the 3 children). The only positive we got back was Hotel St. Jacques. Reaching them, we realised they had re-arranged their bookings to make sure that our rooms were close to each other. The rooms are moderately sized and sparkling clean. The furniture style is Louis XV. Some sizable pieces of old furniture and oil paintings dot the corridors. Our bedroom had the painted friezes on the wall and the ceiling, as well as the wonderful plaster roses. The cupboard, however was the french version of B&Q and had one broken shelf. The views from the windows are entirely what you'd expect. So is the noise! We had a team of workmen digging up the street lights - I slep through it but my son didn't. We were both entertained by looking down and watching the workmen trying to work out how to get a bike which had been chained up to a lamp post off without breaking it. (It involved a digger and crane - once off, a workmen gave the bike a clean). The hotel staff were always helpful during our four night stay. We were given full explainations of how to get to Parc Asterix by train or bus. The breakfast seems to be run by one sweet but over-worked lady. If you're her only customer, you'll be fed promptly! The best places to eat were the adjacent Italian Cafe and the near-by boulangerie. Also, the cafe Zigzag, near the Sourbon and behind the hotel is great. Just follow the smell of garlic bread.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St. Jacques - Great location”
Reviews.Author: tripadaddict
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a super location - only a short stroll and you arrive at Notre Dame. We had 2 triple rooms, one of which was fine and the other which had a toilet you had to back into to use! The rooms did have an electric fan which was great and we also had a small balcony from which we watched the world go by. The hotel is in the Latin Quarter and there are endless restaurants, shops etc very close by. Breakfast in the hotel was OK but pretty basic and it can be very busy after 9am - you may have to wait in reception until a table is free. All in all, the location of the hotel makes up for everything and we thoroughly enjoyed our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good...for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Andrew9
Reviews.Content: Single room for two nights Great location and clean room with a spacious enough bathroom and shower that worked. That's really all you need in Paris. Plenty of shops and restaurants around and it felt safe. My room was facing the back and noise was not a problem. Minor complaints: 1) When I came back to the hotel in the middle of the night it took ages for the night porter to get to the door - he'd clearly been sleeping somewhere. It was quite worrying standing out on the street at 3.30AM in the rain wondering if I was going to be let in. 2) I lost a toothbrush and when I asked at reception if they had one he seemed irritated that I would even ask for something like that! He wasn't that helpful pointing me to a local chemist. Anyway, I'd stay there again for the location and cleanliness of the place.

Reviews.Title: “great everything! except no air con”
Reviews.Author: jerseyjo17
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel St. Jacques was absolutely amazing. The location is perfect, with the Pantheon and Notre Dame just a few blocks away as well as great boulevards (St. Michel and St. Germaine). There is also a post office and a laundry mat close by. The metro stop is about block away. The staff is very accommodating and coming from London where the rooms are tiny as a closet, our room compared at Hotel St. Jacques, was HUGE with a couch, desk, nice double bed, tv, telephone, and a balcony. While there is no air, the fan was fine for the amount of time we spent in the room. I recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Just right!”
Reviews.Author: Jimyk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights at the hotel the third week of May. The hotel's location was perfect, we could walk most places and it was well located for buses and metro as well. There were many nice little restaurants that were just outside the door. The rooms were clean and well appointed and all the staff went out of thier way to be helpful. I would highly recommend anyone looking for a hotel in Paris to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Get street facing room”
Reviews.Author: fpiesiec
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel St Jacques May 2007. We opted for the top floor after reading all the reviews. The stairs up was not the problem. However, we ended up with a back facing room--just with a small dormer window leaving the room very dark most of the time and there was no view at all. The size of the room was adequate as well as the facilities. The elevator was small but always came promptly. The hostess was very helpful in reserving La Reminet for dinner for us. The convenience of location is unbeatable--short stroll away from Notre Dame, the Parthenon, Metro stops, St Germain de Pres.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were there now......”
Reviews.Author: ritdog
Reviews.Content: May 10, 2007: We stayed at the Hotel St. Jacques on our honeymoon for a week in November 2002, in Room 25, which is on the top floor corner, with a great balcony with beautiful views of the local streets. It's within easy walking distance of Notre Dame, the Pantheon, subway, local stores and restaurants. The decor was getting a little tired when we were there, but renovations were just starting, so it must look nice now. The room was clean, with a spotless bathroom and shower. The staff was very helpful and cheerfull, especially Alexi, at night. Room 25 at that time had very thin walls, which we found out one night when a raucous party of 4 started up next door. I just cleared my throat (!) , and a shocked silence hit like a brick! Heard nothing but whispering from then on. We still laugh about that, and the teeny but very serviceable elevator. We can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Quartier Latin, near bus and metro”
Reviews.Author: sullidesk
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Jacques' great amenity is its location. In addition, they have a great staff. The rooms are very clean and quaint. You can hear some noise through the walls, sorry fellow Americans, but our voices carry the most so keep it down. Of course, people were happy to be quiet when asked so it really wasn't a problem. The exterior of the hotel was used in the film, Charade. The interior is charming too with lots of faux paintings. You are near everything and a good local place to eat is Brasserie Balzar, but reserve in advance. Lots of beautiful sites nearby. If you are visiting as a young adult or with your college aged kids, it is really great because you are right there next to the Sorbonne. We stayed for two weeks and it was perfect -- right price and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend highly!”
Reviews.Author: The_Kennedies
Reviews.Content: Our family spent considerable time searching for a hotel for our first trip to Paris, and we were greatly rewarded with a perfect choice. Needing a room for 3, I dreaded having a cot pulled out of a closet for our 16-year old daughter. Hotel St. Jacques was one of the few places who booked triple rooms. The staff couldn't have been more gracious, helpful and kind. They arranged transportation to and from the airport for us. We had a double bed and a single side by side in a room that was of adequate size (esp. for Paris, from what I have read). The shower 's spray was hearty and the lovely tiled bathroom included a towel warmer, which we loved. Our room was cleaned daily. The hotel had a delightful breakfast room and a small cocktail area which we enjoyed several times. Lovely decor was seen throughout the hotel corridors. We walked to the Pantheon, Luxembourg, Notre Dame, and the Musee Orsay , rue Moufftard, and the Paradis Latin Caberet. We easily found our way via the Metro to all of the other attractions we chose to visit (Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Sacre Couer, Opera Garnier, Galeries Lafayette, Champs Elysees). There was a lively street square catering to tourists very close to the hotel, and we walked there for low priced meals and snacks as well as shopping for souvenirs. We found 2 pastry markets within a stone's throw of the hotel for breakfasts and enjoyed several delicious fine dinners in the immediate area. There were ATMS close by as well, so we could get small amounts of cash to carry instead of the worry of carrying around a bankroll. There were 2 payphones nearby where we could use our MCI calling card to call home. The only drawback was that the noise from the street went on until the wee hours, so we needed good earplugs to get to sleep. But that would not stop us from returning to the Hotel St-Jacques; it's a very nice place to stay, affordable, beautiful, and in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location--Simply Charming!”
Reviews.Author: CricketDenver
Reviews.Content: My college-age daughter and I stayed at Hotel St. Jacques for 5 nights over spring break, March 19-23, 2007. It was our first time to the great City of Paris, and we were delighted to call Hotel St. Jacques home for the week. Our room was on the third floor, #15, complete with a small balcony and views of the top of Notre Dame and the Pantheon. (Knowing that our hotel was between these great landmarks gave us a good sense of orientation when we veered off the beaten path on our daily outings.) We had twin beds in the main bedroom; next to the bathroom, there was another small bedroom where we stored our luggage. The entire hotel is decorated very nicely. Our room had beautiful moulding and a nice painting. It was always very clean and tidy when we came back from sightseeing. The beds were quite comfortable, too...we walked a lot each day, so we had no trouble sleeping. The front desk staff was friendly and always helpful when we had questions. We had breakfast only one morning in the hotel, and the food was great...as was our server. Overall, we had a wonderful experience with Hotel St. Jacques, and we would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Paris. Thank you for a wonderful time, St. Jacques! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Oh Where Have You Gone Audrey Hepburn?”
Reviews.Author: painter/traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the following in order of priority: location, reviews here, and a guidebook. Oddly, none of the recent books mention the place, in spite of it's primo location. I suspect that this is because it strikes me as a princess who is a bit past her prime. Belle epoque decor, with little statues in niches and the evidently obligatory tromp l'oeil works in the breakfast basement. Incidentally, the breakfast is on the low end of typical Parisian hotels. I live in NYC and suffer from spotty hot water year-round - imagine my surprise when I discovered no hot water for a day during my stay. Loved the cheesey guidebook in the room with "paris and its unavoidable delights..." Bonuses include friendly staff and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: AuldHarry
Reviews.Content: The Saint-Jacques is to be recommended to anyone looking for well-located, great value Paris accommodation. We stayed in room 31, one of least expensive rooms located on the top floor. The room was of a good size, spotlessly clean and warmly decorated. Best of all there was a small walk-out balcony with views of both Notre Dame and the Pantheon. The bathroom was small but certainly adequate and again has good views from the admittedly cramped shower. Had absolutely no complaints about the Saint Jacques and the reception were all very helpful with any queries we had. The location is perfect for the Latin Quarter and beyond. Notre Dame is just over 5 minutes walk and from the Marais you can make it back in around a 15 minute walk through great street-scenery all the way. Rue Mouffetard with all its bars and restaurants is even less than 5 minutes away in the other direction. This is the perfect, value, Paris accommodation and I would recommend it without reservation. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Not for me...”
Reviews.Author: MikeLaw
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel directly for a Valentines surprise for my wife and based my choice on the TripAdvisor reviews, the hotels location and it's website. We took the RER from CDG and it worked well with an easy walk from the Luxembourg metro stop. The St. Jacques reception area was clean, well presented and with a tiny bar area. However, it was a disappointment that the receptionist chose to continue speaking on the telephone as we booked in and we got a very cursory welcome. I had requested a superior room with bath and balcony and, whilst the room was pleasantly decorated and the balcony was there, we had to put up with a very small shower which had seen better days. The room had a smallish flat screen TV, a sofa and a wardrobe that would struggle to hold more than 3 days worth of clothes. Another downside of the room (#7) was that the double glazed door to the balcony did nothing to cut out the noise from the street outside. We had another noise issue from the room above us (#12) and the hotel did not handle this well at all. We totally accept that noise does travel from room to room and sometimes you are lucky and sometimes you are not. However, when it sounds like a herd of elephants are moving backwards and forwards across your ceiling, enough is enough. We heard the occupant(s) noisily return around midnight on our first night and they disturbed our sleep. I went downstairs to ask the receptionist to ask them to be quiet and he rang the offending room without getting a reply. He did get a reply from another room the family had booked with the lady saying she would turn her TV down....however this was not the problem. The noise above us subsided until we again were awoken at 5:30am as the 'elephants' again began their march across our ceiling. I went down to reception to complain yet again and found the offending 'elephant' in reception. He couldn't have cared less and gave just a cursory apology with a shrug of the shoulders. Worse still, the receptionist said nothing to him. Perhaps if the receptionist had made more effort to solve the initial complaint the second incident might not have occured - quite why he didn't think of going up to knock on the door was a mystery. On reflection I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Place”
Reviews.Author: erinireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the St. Jacques over Christmas. I spent weeks searching for the perfect hotel before finally deciding on the St. Jacques. I am so glad that I did! This was our third time to Paris, and I was looking for a hotel with charm and uniqeness, something very Parisian. It also needed to be within a reasonable price range. The St. Jacques fit all of these perfectly, and it was even better in person than in the pictures. The decor was above my expectations, the staff were very friendly, and it was very quiet in an excellent part of town. It was a five minute walk to the Notre Dame, and there are several good restaurants around. The Latin Quarter is a great part of town to stay in. The restaurant next door the Petit Perigourdine is especially good. We also enjoyed walking up to the Pantheon and to the Jardin to Luxembourg, only a five minute walk. This has got to be one of the best deals in town, the price is so good and the atmosphere cant be beat! The only negative thing I have to say is that if your rate includes breakfast you are only allowed to order the small "plaisir" breakfast for free. We did not know this, we were not informed until the day we checked out and had to pay for the difference for the "gourmand" breakfasts we ordered. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “not a Charade, but a Charmer”
Reviews.Author: VickiW
Reviews.Content: The setting for the Audrey Hepburn movie "Charade", this hotel had lots of charm and character. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and although our triple room was small, it had a separate bedroom for our 3rd guest which was a lovely surprise.
