The location was great - an easy 10 minute walk to the Metro, Notre Dame and many caffe's and restaurants to choose from. I would definately return to this hotel when next in beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel St. Jacques!”
Reviews.Author: oceanprincess428
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel St. Jacques for our honeymoon from Sept. 19 - 25th and we were very pleased. Our room was 124 Euro a night and had one main room, a bathroom, and then a smaller bedroom on the other side of the bathroom. We were able to store all of our luggage in there so our sleeping area wasn't a mess. Our room was always clean and made up when we returned back from sightseeing. The water was always hot and the noise level was not bad at all. The first night was the loudest, but we just shut the windows and popped in some ear plugs. It's in a great location - 4 or 5 minute walk from the metro and about a 7 minute walk from Notre Dame. Great little restaraunt next the hotel - I can't remember the name off hand - Petit P - something :-) - best meal we had in Paris! The hotel staff was always friendly and willing to help which we were very appreciative of since our French is not good at all. I would def. stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: MonsieurChips
Reviews.Content: The Hotel St Jacques enjoys a wonderful location, situated a mere 5 min walk form the Metro and within walking distance of Notre Dame, the Pantheon and the Jardins De Luxembourg. The area is very safe and quiet and the rooms were of a good size, as was the en-suite bathroom. The highlight of our stay was the view from our top floor room, we could see both Notre Dame and the Sacre Coeur from our bathroom window! The only grumble I had is the poor sound proofing as we were able to hear every word of our neighbour's conversation and the noise from their TV was very intrusive...

Reviews.Title: “Very successful stay”
Reviews.Author: hronde
Reviews.Content: I would definitely return to this hotel. Some of the perks include: - location. At the heart of the Quartier Latin, St Jacques is walking distance from the Notre Dame cathedral and many restaurants. The street is very safe and near a métro and RER stop (direct trains to/from CDG airport) - service. The staff were very hands-off and discrete, but polite and helpful when consulted - facilities. The hotel has a room for left luggage (checkout is at midday). There is someone at reception throughout the night which allows you to return as late as you like. - rooms. Although slightly on the small side, our room had an en suite bathroom and balcony with views of Notre Dame and the Panthéon. The room was very clean, and I believe each room has a different theme, all with 19th century features. Overall it was a very successful stay, however we did not eat any meals at the hotel so I cannot comment on the food! I would definitely recommend it and stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “An exquisite little gem!”
Reviews.Author: spagalena
Reviews.Content: Hotel St Jacques is perfectly positioned in the Latin Quarter. A brief 5-10 minute walk to Notre Dame, at the base of the hill from the Pantheon (from a side view) with lots of fabulous bars, restaurants and shops only a stones throw away if you wander the beautiful cobbled streets. I booked directly through the hotel website for a triple room and I requested a view of the Pantheon & Notre Dame's towers (as seen on one of these other reviews!) and this was exactly what we got - superb! I think the rooms on the top floor have a mini balcony but we were quite happy just to pop our heads out of the window and look left and right! The room was of an adequate size for the three of us and all our luggage with space to move around. The bathroom was small but the shower more than made up for that as it was incredibly powerful and just what you need to wake you up in the mornings. I can't comment on what the breakfasts were like as we always chose to go to a cafe or boulangerie which I would highly recommend (plenty in the immediate area) as it means you can sit, watch the world go by and enjoy your typical french breakfast! The hotel is full of character with wonderful wall paintings and a sweeping spiral staircase which we always took down as the lift is VERY small (possibly fits four at a real squash!). I will certainly book to stay here the next time I am in Paris as this hotel really is a little gem - the price really is astounding for the location, views and comfort!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: dlmykles
Reviews.Content: Want a moderately priced hotel in Paris? Recently remodeled, the Hotel St-Jacques is located on a quiet street (rue des Ecoles) between the Pantheon and the Seine. It's a short walk to the Luxembourg Gardens and Notre Dame. Rooms are comfortable, clean and well-appointed. The multilingual staff are cordial and helpful. There are a wide range of restaurants nearby. Breakfast is extra. Rooms on the back side of the hotel are quieter. This is the place we keep coming back to when we're in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MhairiMcL
Reviews.Content: July 18 2006 Our recent stay at Hotel Saint Jacques was very pleasant. The room, on the first floor was well appointed, typically French, with a very nice small but adequate bathroom - much more pleasant than staying in a Chain Hotel. The room was cleaned very well with clean towels daily. Although there was no air conditioning, a fan was provided. We did however have to open the window as it was extremely hot and it was rather noisy, but visiting a City that is to be expected. A room on an upper floor would be nice and perhaps we could enjoy a view towards Notre Dame - perhaps we could request this on our next visit which is already being planned. An excellent hotel far above the Two Star Rating.

Reviews.Title: “Qualified Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Motorsikl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel St. Jacques on three occasions over the past two years, starting with a two week stay in July 2004, most recently in Feb 2006. I've spent a total of 26 or 27 nights there and will return without hesitation. And I recommend it with one qualification It's a two star hotel. People who want lot of attention or need to be waited on should consider paying for a three or four star hotel. It's clean, comfortable and has a great location: 15 minutes from Notre Dame, 5 minutes from the Pantheon, the Boule Mich and the Metro station at Place Maubert. I find the staff friendly if occasionally aloof (except Brigitte who is always very friendly and helpful), but after all this is France. And I've had the experience of coming down with the flu two days after checking in (apparently caught on the plane), asking for recommendations at the desk after hiding out in my room for three days, and having them very helpfully offer to find me a doctor. But I ended up doing it the way the French do and went to see a pharmacist first (the one on the corner a block to the east, who was also helpful). I found the rooms to be clean and comfortable, but small. This is, after all, a 19th century building. I especially enjoy the skeleton key locks (but use the room safe for valuables). Most of all, it's French. With the occasional odd touch. The player piano in the breakfast room is bizarre. Picture eating your petit dejeuner listening to Perry Como singing Catch a Falling Star with the player piano banging away in accompanyment. I plan to return. And I recommend it to friends, with that one qualification.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Ambience and Warmth”
Reviews.Author: LFA
Reviews.Content: Considering the pricing, location and decor, the St. Jacques is an outstanding value. Rated as a 2 star hotel, it has to be at the top of its class. Rooms are very attractive - many with wall and ceiling murals, moire wallpapers, and updated baths - and lots of history in the building and neighborhood. Convenient to many Central Paris attractions (Universities, Notre Dame, Louvre, etc.) and easy access to public transportation (Metro and bus). Desk staff is very friendly and accomodating (especially Brigitte). Bedding was very comfortable although bedspreads were rather worn. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance. A great choice even for families.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Paris - Hotel Saint Jacques”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our entire family had a wonderful time in Paris and much of it was due to this hotel and it's location in the Latin Quarter. The rooms were very comfortable with a feeling of French decor and include a fan, as like most of Paris, there is no air conditioning. The service we received could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for nearly 28 years and I find all the comments very disturbing and bias I have only known friendliness, humility and smiles in all these years If any seasoned traveller does not know the rules of hotel life then rather stay in your own country and stop winging about what if's and could have's My greatest appreciation to everyone at the Hotel St Jacques, this is my home whenever I visit Paris No questions asked

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DClawyer
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 days at the Hotel Saint Jacques and it exceeded our already high expectations. For only 124 Euro we had a large room (especially for Euro standards) with a wrap-around balcony with views of Notre Dame and the Pantheon. The bathroom had been remodeled recently as well. Having stayed in Paris 10-12 times in various hotels throughout the city, Hotel Saint Jacques has been the best. (keeping in mind I/we stay in 2-3 star hotels when in Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ambiance but be weary of the Maid staff...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Hotel St. Jacque last April-May 2005 for a week and a half. Being that we were non-smokers we found it hard to deal with the fact that almost everyone smokes. The maids smoke when they cleaned. A couple times we headed back up to our room to grab something that we forgot and we saw through some open doors, some of the maids sitting on the beds of the room that they were to clean, talking to each other and smoking it up in people's rooms. The maids also would always try to open our doors when we were getting ready to head out for the day. One day we slept in late and the maids didn't even knock but just opened the door w/out notice. It was sort of odd. Besides the awkward maid service we found the hotel ambiance and location to be Fabulous! We stayed up on the 5th floor and our room had a wonderful view of the street w/two balconies. Their hotel reservation staff was very friendly. One gal in peticular named Bridget was great. She showed us to some awesome near by restaurants and was very friendly and open to calling us taxis. The location is ideal and you'll be impressed by their decor througout the hotel. If you want to experience Paris w/out paying a 5 star price, then I recommend staying at the Hotel St Jacque, just make sure to lock up things in your room before you head out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in (or by) the Hotel St. Jacques”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Money was stolen from our room in the hotel, on New Year's Eve. 2005, when the staff knew we would be out for the evening, and departing the following morning. We very strongly suspect one specific member of the hotel staff, with a second person doing the break-in, as we now realize that our room was entered surreptitiously two times: the first time damaging a suitcase, and the second time to steal the money. The staff member in question was very hostile from the inception of our stay, and acted strangely and defiantly when informed of the theft. In general, we found the reception staff to be unfriendly/reluctant to answer questions, and, in the case of one or more individuals, possibly criminal. Would avoid this place at all costs !!!! (or you may pay much more than the room rate, as we did).

Reviews.Title: “I shall return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely delighted in this hotel; I hve stayed in others which I found perfectly serviceable but H.St.J. was a home. I stayed in a very pretty single without private facilities & was perfectly happy with my decision. The shower was not timed, it was clean & there was plenty of hot water. As someone who prefers only a hot beverage for breakfast, I was very happy to find, despite my tea snobbery, that it was quite good. I found the people in the hotel very friendly & the location was wonderful. The only bit of unpleasantness was that 45 pounds,which I should have put in the room safe, were taken from my bag; I had some trouble setting the safe to my password, but didn't bother asking anyone for help, I'm sure, had I done so that it would have been forthcoming. I left a note for the owner to let him know what had transpired & would have very much appreciated an apology. I am planning to return to Paris shortly & will make Hotel St. Jacques my home once again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Goof
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to celebrate our second anniversary in Paris. After a lot of searching we found this hotel. When we got there our room had a leak problem, but they move us to another room, right away with no problems. I purchased my museums passes in advance from here and they suppose to arrive to the hotel. We asked for them, and they were not there, I asked the in the front desk, if they could please help me to place the phone call to find out about them, and I got an absolutely not, unfortunately I do not speak French and I was not able to solve my problem, and they refuse to help me. Last night my husband was VERY sick in the room, when I went downstairs to find out where to get a Pharmacy or something I got the same indifference, at 4:00 am I had to run out of the hotel looking for some help in the street, no one even offered to get me a taxi to get to the closest pharmacy. The hotel is charming, clean, and has a GREAT location, but if you have a problem do not expect the staff to help you with anything! We will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrummieGaV
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely tradditional Paris Hotel in a fantastic area with lots of really good bars and resturants. We had a Superior Double on the 5th floor which meant we experienced no street noise and the room itself was very spacious compared to other Paris Hotels we've stayed in. If you want 5 star luxery with all mod cons don't book the St Jacques but if you want to experience the Real Paris I highly recomend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good points: The property is at an excellent location with friendly, helpful, and courteous staff. BTW, in general people in France are friendly and courteous. Wife says the hotel is very cozy and romantic. The deluxe room for 118 euros is pretty spacious especially for Paris. Bad points: Walls are paper thin – can hear everything next door and outside. Ear plugs are a must to sleep. I used them. My wife can sleep through anything so she has no complaints here. Bathroom sink clogged. Bathroom had mold/fungus. Heater did not work. We paid 118 euros and I think that’s a bit too much for an old hotel. But then, this is Paris. Overall for 118 euros it is okay - you won’t regret it but I would search around for better deals in the Latin quarter or St. Germain des Pres area. Tip: If you have luggage, do not try the train from CDG. The hotel can arrange for shuttle at 18 euro per person. Also, do not buy any metro day passes. The location is so good that you may not be using the metro much. Go for the 10 journey tickets. We bought passes and they were a waste.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value and Parisian Charm!”
Reviews.Author: waytogogirl
Reviews.Content: This small oasis in Paris is just as advertised here. I had done a lot of research on the hotel before I left and it was worth the effort because I ended up booking the St. Jacques hotel and could not have been happier. We had two rooms, one twin larger room and one standard double. Both were very attractive with walk out windows, beautiful molding on ceiling and very charming decor. Keep in mind this is a small two star hotel and a very old building and therefore you may have some minor inconveniences. The room did not have a plug available for any curling iron (I brought a duel voltage one) or any other electrical appliance in the bathroom other than a small shaver- in either room. This was a problem because I have to curl my hair. I ended up unplugging the TV every time I curled my hair and did not have a mirror close. Also, you may have some noise due to thin walls and some slight street noise, although this is reduced at night. There is no air conditioning and in summer I may consider a different hotel. But, for fall the minor were worth it given the great value, location and charm of the hotel. The hotel staff were great. I will have to give kudos especially to Bridget at the front desk. She was very helpful in several situations. One being a major problem on our return in which we learned a huge lesson. When the transfer service bluvan picked us up they left my most important bag with passport, ids, money sitting on the curb outside the hotel. Although it was mostly due to the driver missing the bag, I will always watch to make sure my bags are loaded before getting on a transportation service from now on. Bridgett quickly had my bad put on a taxi and tied it shut for me. This was a very stressful situation and she was very helpful. I had the hotel breakfast and it was convenient, but I found a croissant and coffee at the boulangerie at the corner cheaper for me since I did not need much for breakfast. The rooms have CNN in english. The maid service was good except for once letting us totally run out of soap- no big deal. The location was perfect in the charming Latin Quarter and one block from the metro, although the major metro with many connections is about three blocks at the St. Michel/Notre Dame stop. We used both. Restaurants are everywhere and I would recommend the Petit Prince around the corner from the hotel as well as the Peridaund's which is on Rue St. Jacques. Also, we had so much fun at night in the club district around Rue de la Huchette, especially the historic jazz club, Le Caveau de la Huchette. I can't wait to return and I would love to stay at Hotel St. Jacque again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, loved it”
Reviews.Author: mediachick
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my first trip to Paris, and this hotel was perfect. My room, on the very top floor, was small (with no balcony), but after doing a lot of research, I was prepared for the small hotel rooms in Paris. And why spend time in the hotel when you're in Paris?! I was only in my room to shower or sleep. The location is great -- a block from the Maubert-Mutualite metro, walking distance to Notre Dame as well as numerous cafes, brasseries and bars in the Latin Quarter. The staff was really nice and spoke to me in English even though I tried to speak French with them. Every morning, I walked to the end of the block and bought a small quiche from the neighborhood boulangerie (or is it charcuterie), got a coffee from one of the cafes in the neighborhood, then I was off to explore. Because my room was warm, even in November, I kept the window open and definitely got street noise. The first night, some guy was singing really loudly, I think it was Beethoven's Ode to Joy, and he just kept singing it over and over. But it's a big city, and the hotel can't exactly control drunk singing people outside. I would definitely stay at Hotel Saint-Jacques again. The location is perfect, the staff was very friendly, the rooms are very clean, and it's really a bargain in expensive Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel St Jacques”
Reviews.Author: conniepab
Reviews.Content: We are Americans and although this is our 1st trip to Paris, my husband and I found this hotel's atmosphere charming and wonderful. Our room was on the 5th floor, had two large windows with balconey, lovely decor on ceiling and walls. For the price and the wonderful location, this hotel is a gem. Would definitely stay here again. Had a drink called "absinthe" at the bar. Taste like a strong peppermint schnapps which I liked. Bathroom was small but knew that before we arrived. Had outlet for low voltage items like shaver. I brought a adapter and converter for my hair straigtener but did not work because we are not allowed to use higher voltage electrical items in the room (hotel policy). My husband took his shirts to a nearby facility to get his clothes pressed. Has a hair blower. Loved this hotel and nearby brasseries, restaurants and people! Wear comfortable shoes! In addition, we met a Canadian who stayed at the hotel as we were leaving for the airport, that said she had stayed at other Paris hotels more expensive, but she found Hotel St Jacques charming great location friendly and would stay here again. I agree wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the St. Jacques and would gladly stay there again. The rooms are a bit small yet are tastefully decorated. The entire staff proved to be helpful and very friendly, and all spoke English. You can't beat the location-- within walking location to many of our favorite spots and only a block away from a Metro stop. Nice restaurants and little shops are everywhere. This is a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of summer...”
Reviews.Author: soundbyte
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult hotel to summarize easily. It has an outstanding location and a certain shabby Parisian charm. What it doesn't have is air conditioning, privacy or any way to survive both Parisian summer AND Parisian noise. You can close the windows and stifle or open the windows and enjoy the endless auditory ambience of the Vth (read: "noise"). In fact, you can get downright intimate with Paris, since open windows also mean a fine view for you AND the people across the street (don't try to use the sheer drapes for privacy with the window-doors fully open. We were informed that the drapes must hang inside). The desk staff is fine and Brigitte was especially helpful. But there are any many hotels along the Rue des Ecoles and, in summer at least, spoiled Americans like us might prefer something a little cooler. For the rest of the year I would certainly consider returning. PS They do provide a fan. And they did put up (barely) with our very messy teenagers. So I would declare it a draw.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've now stayed at the St. Jacques for two consecutive summer visits, one in July 2004 and again in June 2005. Last year we had a double and a triple room, and this year we had a triple. We selected the St. Jacques because of its consistently high TripAdvisor reviews, and found it exactly as advertised. Spacious rooms, friendly, english-speaking staff, fantastic location. The street can be a little noisy in summer with those big windows open, but the big windows are part of what makes the St. Jacques great. This year, they had remodeled their breakfast room and they served a wonderful French breakfast to start the day. I find the St. Jacques to be an exceptional value, combining reasonable rates, comfortable rooms, great service, and a central location. In the morning, stroll down a few blocks, grab a croissant at the bakery, and continue your stroll to Notre Dame--it's what a trip to Paris should be!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Canuck317
Reviews.Content: The thing to keep in mind about Paris hotels is that sometimes atmosphere, location, and character are more important than expecting the standard hotel room that are the norm in Canada and the States. The Hotel St.Jacques has all of these qualities.....in abundance. I stayed here for a week starting April 16th. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the area is extremely safe with fresh pastries, meat and cheese shops across from the Metro stop (which is only 2 short blocks away), not to mention two wine stores within a block!! They have an internet kiosk right on the first floor (convenient!!) and a 30-minute access card will only cost 6 euros. The first thing that will make you laugh is the size of the lift.....one person at a time with luggage.....and two people maximum without luggage! I have closets that are bigger, but it functions just fine. We had room #14 on the third floor, one twin bed and one double bed, 118 euros and while it was small, it was very comfortable and had a large window that if you looked out gave you a view of the Pantheon. It was very neat and clean, the wallpaper was slightly shabby, but who cares about wallpaper when you are in Paris?? Fresh towels every day, comfortable beds and large pillows, and a TV that gets CNN. Loud street noise is a little unavoidable, but it is sporadic and quite tolerable. Their definition of "view of Notre Dame" might be stretched a little, but when you can walk to Notre Dame within minutes, it doesn't really matter if you can see if perfectly out your window. Great restaurants in the area.....highly recommend the Petit Prince (they have a chocolate mousse cake with raspberry that I'm still dreaming about!!) up the hill around the corner, and the Pre Terre on Thenard street. We were the only tourists in the place, and were treated to authentic French cuisine. Bottom line: I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to friends. Safe, clean, affordable, close to Metro....what else do you need?

Reviews.Title: “Peter Pan Room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After doing considerable research preparing for our Paris trip, we chose to stay at L'Hotel St. Jacque. It was just perfect for us. We stayed on the top floor in the least expensive room to save money. Our tiny balcony offered views of the Pantheon and Notre Dam; the large French doors to the balcony were something from Peter Pan; Wendy could have flown out any moment with Peter. The staff was wonderful and gave us tips on incredible small local restaurants and other interesting places to visit that we would never have found on our own. A light breakfast was included with our room and the coffee was great. The room was neat and comfortable - nothing fancy but very serviceable. The location was perfect and within easy walking distance to numerous sites. We even found an outdoor market just a few blocks away one Sunday morning and indulged in fresh fruits and exquisite cheeses. When I return to Paris, it is my intention to again stay at this affordable, hospitable hotel in absolutely the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby chic romance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a great deal, a lovely hotel with friendly service in an incredible location. It's a romantic setting with painted ceilings, not particularly fancy but very Latin Quarter. Only complaint was the noise of what seemed like daily morning vacuuming outside our room. But we heard no noise from the street. Service was lovely -- the maid not only cleaned the room but folded our clothes. Two blocks to the Pantheon, four to Notre Dame, two to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: ferd62
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within a block of the metro, has been completely renovated: New windows, window and wall treatments, etc. We stayed in room 19 ("Superior" @ E118), on the corner of the 4th floor, beds (3 singles) were small, but comfortable (firm). Room was small by american standards, as was the shower (but there was BEAUCOUP hot water). The room had a small TV (mostly french), hair drier and electronic safe. The other couple with whom we were travelling stayed in room 25 above us, which was comparable. The staff was most attentive, and all the desk people spoke english. Housekeeping was very good. We ate breakfast in the new breakfast room twice (E8), and everything was fine - My wife loved the coffee, and I enjoyed the chocolat chaud. The cafe across the street (Peregoid???) served me the best potatoes I've ever eaten, mashed with cheese and who knows what else, with a good steak au poivre. We all enjoyed our meals there, and the service was quite good. There was street noise to contend with (we slept with the bathroom window open), and we occasionally heard the people next door and our friends above. All in all though, we'd go return in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Customer Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My party of 2 people stayed here in Feb. 2003. We arrived after an exhausting overnight bus ride from London, which we thought we'd be able to sleep on. But becuase of the lengthy Chunnel security checks, we were up the whole time. When we arrived in Paris at around 7am, we thought, 'oh, lets take a long shot and see if we can check in around noon or so'. We came in (and we don't speak a word of French) and the staff was incredibly friendly and understanding, and they let us check in at 7:30am!! It was a trip-saver, for otherwise we would have wasted the whole day catching up on sleep. The room was small but perfect - it was on the top floor I think - and even had somewhat of a balcony (really the roof) where you could turn one way and see the Pantheon, and turn the other and see Notre Dame! The room was very cute, with lots of touches to make it romantic (i.e. interesting paint choices, artistic headboard, etc). Even more stunningly good customer service came months later, after we returned home and realized we had lost a role of film. We searched everywhere for days, until finally I realized we might have left it in one of the rooms. I emailed several of the hotels we stayed at, and the only one to reply to me was Hotel St. Jacques! They found a role of film matching the description (we had happened to mark the film with an 'X') and said they'd be happy to send it out. I wrote them back and said I would send them a self-addressed stamped envelope, but they said 'don't worry about it' and a few days later, I received the film in the mail from them!! The role was full of treasured pictures of our trip, and for them to go out of their way to not only find it and keep it safe for months, and then send it to us for free, is just absolutely wonderful. To even call it 'great customer service' is not glowing enough of a compliment -- it was just an extremely kind and caring thing for one human being to do for another. It also struck me that during Feb. 2003 the American press and government were saying some nasty things about France; but this hotel staff took the utmost care in making this yankee feel welcome and wanted in Paris, even as giant protests against the US government were marching down the streets outside. The rooms in all hotels vary slightly in quality but in time you forget the differences, as they are, after all, just places to sleep. But I will truly never forget the thoughfulness of this hotel's staff, which shines far and above any other place I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “First Time to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_Roary
Reviews.Content: This was our very first visit to Paris. We had chosen this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, and on recommendations from several travel guides. We stayed at this hotel for 8 days in December. There were a lot of positive things about our stay: 1) The staff were very friendly 2) Our room (#25) had great views of the Notre Dame, and Pantheon. 3) Given all the stories about small hotel rooms in Europe, the room was a bit bigger than we expected 4) The hotel is in a good location, within walking distance of several attractions 5) The hotel is relatively cheap 6) The hotel is clean and tidy 7) The hotel is very close to the metro station 8) The staff spoke English, which was helpful because our French is rather weak On the downside: 1) You can hear quite a bit of renovation noise (which I admit is outside of the hotel's control), and from adjacent rooms. A cheap set of earplugs would be a good idea. 2) It was difficult to get a hot shower. The water temperature fluctuated a lot. 3) The beds were small and weren't all that comfortable. But I guess this is expected given the price (again, this is our first visit to Paris, so I don't have a reliable frame of reference... only North American hotels). So overall, we were pleased with our decision to stay at the Hotel St. Jacques. It is a basic hotel that delivers everything that a budget traveler could want. Anything more, and we we would have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Truly overrated”
Reviews.Author: alexander.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for six nights in December. The good point is the location. The bad points are numerous. The walls are paper thin, and you hear EVERYTHING being said and done clearly. The toilet in the hall is used constantly during the night. They are repainting the second floor and the paint fumes permeate the whole building. This is not the restuarant construction. This is work being done IN the hotel. The shower stall wouldn't drain. We stood in dirty water up to our ankles to bathe. When the problem was reported, we were told the maid had just cleaned and would come check it. No one came so my husband removed the drain cover everytime we showered so we wouldn't flood the bathroom. The sheets were never changed in six nights. Towels were forgotten. The straw that broke the camel's back was when I asked Joe if he would call our shuttle to reconfirm pickup for the airport. He said no because he didn't do business with Blue Van(GREAT shuttle). I didn't ask him to make the reservation just reconfirm. Since he spoke French I thought it would be easier than if I did it. I know this is budget hotel (118euro) a night, but we have been to Paris 7times and 6times in budget hotels (i.e. College du France--SUPER). None were this bad. I would never stay here again. If you think the noise is bad now, just wait until that restuarant is complete on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value, Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Paris having stayed at Hotel St Jacques for three nights. We had a triple room and I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the room. We had NO issues with noise from construction of the 1st floor restaurant although street traffic was noisy when we had the window open which would be more of an issue in the warm weather. The best things about this hotel are the location, value and staff. Bridgett was great both in confirming my reservation and in helping make dinner reservations. I highly recommend Hotel St Jacques.

Reviews.Title: “Great value; a little dusty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was charming and the rooms were large and clean, but a bit old. I was surprised that it was a two-star. The front desk people were always very nice. The only thing is that because the building and rooms are so old, it gets a little dusty- not so good for those who are allergic to dust. But the price was perfect, as well as the location!

Reviews.Title: “October 2004”
Reviews.Author: Gigi54
Reviews.Content: Excellent value! Our room, #5 was larger than expected and the bathroom was modern and more than adequate. I will say, I am use to 4 or 5 star properties (only because I am a travel agent and can usually get low rates), and at first I was disappointed that there was no laundry service or even an iron for guest use. BUT, that being said, everything was GREAT (very nice staff) and I will recommend this to my clients and friends. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!

Reviews.Title: “Made my Paris buying trip a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris Sept. 12-16 this year and was lucky enough to stay here. I even returned on the 21st for a one night stay and had one of the cute singles on the 6th floor- the only negative was dragging the luggage up one flight of winding stairs since the elevator only goes to floor 5. The double room we had was a nice size and beautifully decorated. A lovely street view let us see notre dame from the side of our balcony. The front desk staff was very helpful, speaks english well and helped us with anything we needed. I plan on returning next year and staying again by myself and am very excited. It is close to good restaurants and the metro is one block. Lovely place!

Reviews.Title: “Paris charm at a good price”
Reviews.Author: heyul
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 27-30 and had a great time. The hotel was very clean and uniquely decorated. Our room had a little balcony which you could look out and see Notre Dame to your right and the Pantheon to your left. The bathroom was great--although the closet with the toilet was comically small, but we didn't care. There's alot of street noise at night which could be bothersome to people who are used to it being quiet although we slept fine. I would definately stay here again should the occassion arise!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel SAINT-JACQUES
HotelInfo.Address: 35, rue des Ecoles, 75005 Paris, France
